description:
Before he got killed by a stampede, my dad told me that when we look up at night, the stars are the great Indian dinners of the past looking back at us.

They're not balls of gas billions of lightyears away; they're not fireflies.

My dad MUFASALA DOSA taught me most of what I know in life. Once each year I order out in his memory.

(^_^) LAMB KORMA $16
Most pieces were tender.
0 spiciness, as requested. thx

(^_^) CHICKEN MADRAS $15
Tender chicken w coconut & raisins.
Finish w rum raisin ice cream. Or just rum jk.

(-_^) GARLIC BASIL NAAN $4
It's naan.

Rich. Tasty. Creamy. #thatswhatshesaid #nobromo

Till we find our plates, tablecloth unwinding, in the circleeeeeee the circle of naan...
author: Dan B.

description:
This is an overdue review but I decided to now post it seeing how I pass by the restaurant frequently on my way home.

I ordered the chicken Tikka Masala with a side of rice to go. The Tikka Masala was terrible. Although the chicken was nice and tender, all of it was just way too salty. At one point, all I could taste was salt and had take sips of water in between bites. I'm not overly picky about food and would normally try to eat most of it but I couldn't stand eating any more. Due to my dissatisfaction, I decided to go back to the restaurant in hopes of exchanging it for something else. I went back to the restaurant and told the host/server my problem very politely. I never mentioned a refund. I just wanted to exchange. He seemed annoyed and called somebody else over for help. This new man must be a manager. I told him that I found the tikka masala way too salty and he was explaining how it's supposed to taste like that. I then asked if they taste test their food before serving and he said yes. I was shocked that they would approve of serving something so terribly salty. Anyways, he did let me exchange for something else and I choose the samosas because it seemed like a safe choice. The samosas were surprisingly good so I do recommend those.

Pros: Good portions, they let me exchange for something else, and the samosas were good
Cons: The tikka masala was terrible and I felt they were rude to me when I told them I was dissatisfied with my meal.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Tried to order today via Grubhub. This has been my go to for the last few months because Idly Fries. But, alas, never again. Ordered for lunch today, two hours later, nothing. Called and was told, "The driver was busy and stuff." Exact words. He then offered to deliver my already prepared and cooked food in another hour. That's it. No discount, no "So sorry" nothing. Canceled the order, needless to say. 

Never again, Masala. Never again.
author: Radha K.

description: Overpriced and underwhelming food. $12 for below average masala dosa is too much.
author: Sunil R.

description:
This review is based on my experience through door dash, as I have not dined in here. The order came relatively quickly and as described. 

I order the chicken tikka masala, garlic nan and samosas. Really loved the samosas I had from here. Will definitely order again
author: Lauren P.

description: My friend Jill recommended this delicious Indian restaurant in the Inner sunset district In San Francisco. The restaurant is a gem almost untouched by the hustling and bustling crowd, it's quiet, priced reasonably with a nice ambiance so you can have a conversation . The food, particularly the curries were so delectable and so much to choose from in the menu. I love the spinach dish too! The waiters are helpful and funny. It's BYOB and that's great because you can get wine that would go with your meal so I brought a bottle of Chardonnay to the restaurant.
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description:
Masala Dosa seems like a solid Indian restaurant in the Sunset, serving both North and South Indian cuisine. I was yelping for a place my friends and I could go for lunch after running Bay to Breakers and came across Masala Dosa. 

We arrived around before noon and the place was pretty much empty. We were seated right away in the front where the window was. I ordered the samosa and seek kebab dosa (spicy ground beef filling). The samosa appetizer came with two pieces. It had a nice crispy exterior but the filling was bland. The dosa was pretty good though.

For a party of 9, the food didn't take too long to come out. Service was pretty spotty. With an empty restaurant, I figured it would be easier to get our server's attention. Unfortunately, he was out in the back kitchen most of the time and was hard to flag down.

When it was time to pay our bill, our server informed us he was having issues with his credit card reader that day and asked if we could pay cash. Luckily, we were able to and got an additional 10% off our bill.
author: Steph F.

description:
I would definitely order take out from here. It's nice that the vegan options are so clearly labeled. My masala dosa was tasty and filling. 

The restaurant itself was smoky. We were the only patrons for a bit at lunch, and it was smoky as soon as we walked in, although no food was cooking. Maybe it has poor ventilation in combination with a fireplace? The dosa gets four stars, the restaurant two.
author: Erin M.

description: Ordered through door dash and the order was quick and delicious and would not hesitate to repeat it again since it's near impossible to park around the 9th Avenue area nowadays.
author: Shelton F.

description: Extremely disappointed with this place. I called in an order for delivery and 3 minutes later called back to cancel because my friend and I had a miscommunication about who was going to order the food. Mind you they told me it was going to take one hour for delivery and I called back 3 minutes later to cancel. Three. They refused to cancel my order. If they really started cooking all of the food (he said they would only be able to cancel the rice), I really want to know what is going on with my order for the next 57 minutes as I live 5 blocks away from the restaurant. This is example of greed and bad customer service. I hope you guys enjoy the $37 you charged me, cuz it's the last time you will ever get any of my money.
author: Noah T.

description:
This place was recommended to my friend and me. The food here is great. We both liked the  hearty lentil soup, filling and full of flavor.  Since it was our first time the waiter suggested the Chicken Tikka Masala which was also great. Prices are reasonable and the dish was medium spicy. Rice is extra. 

They have gluten free and vegetarian options. Their menu is extensive, with lots of curries - how do 8 kinds of lamb curry and 11 naan choices sound? Next time I want to try the goat cheese or spiced ground lamb naan! 

Darkish, unassuming interior with gentle, relaxing music. The unisex bathroom was clean. Delivery is free for a pretax minimum of $25. 

One needed improvement though is service. When we walked in, after 2 pm on a Saturday, no one greeted us.  I had to get a kitchen staff member's attention to be seated. Still, that would not stop me from coming back again. I say come very hungry or with a group so you can order a range of tasty food.
author: Mia K.

description:
I was craving for some Masala dosa so I ordered the Sambar Vada and Mysore Masala dosa from them. My food was delivered ahead of Yelp's ETA and unfortunately that was the only positive thing about that night's  experience.

Right from the first bite I knew the vada was stale and the only reason it was bearable to eat was because it was soaked in sambar.

Who makes Masala dosa without coconut chutney ? Apparently these guys do. The green chutney (pudina/mint ?) was also not fresh. The only saving grace was the red chutney. After eating like half of the dosa i threw away the rest of the masala/potatoes and just ate the dosa part.

TL;DR: As someone who grew up in South India this was one of the worst   Masala dosas I ever had.
author: Ruben M.

description: Gluten free dosa, say absolutely no more. I'm thrilled to find this place. I'll be trying each dosa!
author: Arthur D.

description:
The place has a combination of south and north indian menu. Although the name suggests it might be primarily a south indian place, it looked more of north indian. I tried mostly south indian food and the quality of food was below average. Neither it was fresh nor made skillfully. 
The service was ok.
author: Vish B.

description: It was an average food place, not great for vegetarians. I was kind of disappointed with the food. Service was fast but the taste was same in all dishes!
author: Twinkle S.

description:
This is becoming my new go to Indian restaurant in the Sunset. 

The food is great and I get great service.

I ordered delivery through the Eat24 app and my phone never rang when the driver called... instead he waited for a neighbor to let him into my apartment building and he delivered it to the door!
author: Dan R.

description: This place is amazing ! I dream about this place . The customer service was amazing and quick. I highly recommend this place.
author: Charday H.

description:
Price is high as expected but food is not upto the mark. 
Don't try lamb curry it has no taste
author: Gyanadeep S.

description:
I went here for dinner a few nights ago. The Dosas, as others have mentioned, are not very good (despite the restaurant name). The staff was rude and took too long, and there were flies everywhere. 
Also, it's much more expensive than other restaurants like it. Save your money and have a better meal at Gorkha kitchen, Tikka Masala, or Naan and Curry, all in the neighborhood.
author: Will T.

description: This is a cozy restaurant that we just loved! We were looking for a different restaurant that was closed and decided on this one since we love Indian food and they had gluten free offerings. We came in from a chilly SF night and the hostess greeted us with a huge smile. She also pitched in and made sure we were well taken care of.  We ordered pakora for an appetizer and it was amazing. Light and airy, but super flavorful. We moved on to Chicken Tikka and Vegetable Biryani. The Biryani was indeed the ultimate rice dish. The aroma from the spices floated up in the steam. The Chicken Tikka was delicious too. We also treated ourselves to a pea and tomato crispy crepe (I don't remember the Indian name) that came with delicious chutneys. This was amazing!  We finished dinner with a rice pudding flavored with cardamom that we relished every bite.
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
Still thinking about the goat cheese naan. Would totally go back just for that. Everything else was basic and I think they were skimpy on the meat. 

Stopped by late on a Friday night because we were craving Indian food. Craving was fulfilled and the food was good. We ordered samosas, lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, vegetable biryani, naan, and goat cheese naan. Don't judge me, but the goat cheese naan reminded me of a really really yummy herby crispy grilled cheese sandwich. Probably explains why I enjoyed it so much. I've never tried dosa before so perhaps I'll go back to try theirs.

They weren't too attentive. We had to ask for water refills and the check.
author: Mary O.

description: We had Dinner here Sunday evening on Mother's Day Amazing!!! The food is delicious and perfect portions to share family style. The service is impeccable and personal. We had Chana Masala Delicious, Eggplant pakora, chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, Masala Dosa , garlic basil naan , rice! Im thinking of when will I eat here again and what will I have As I'm writing this review!  Today Lunch maybe Dinner!!! Sorry I didn't take any pictures. Thank you for a great meal!!!
author: Rosemarie D.

description: We love to go here when we have Indian food in the Sunset. Tasty vegan options! Great environment and great and friendly service. Parking can be tricky of course
author: Carmen O.

description: We ordered the samosa, naan, garlic naan, rice, chicken curry and aloo palak. They were all amazing and tasty. The restaurant is clean and nice and they had nice service.
author: Hye Lin C.

description:
Misleading name. Not a good place for dosas

This place does not has good Dosa's, horrible chutney. Worst south Indian food that I have ever eaten.
author: Savinay D.

description: I ordered some samosa and took a first bite it was raw. It was not cooked properly. I told waiter about it and he brought another one which was also uncooked. Very bad experience.
author: Mahan K.

description: It's not a Dosa place, let the name not mislead you. They have got a good menu of both north indian and south indian dishes. We ended up here looking for a snack place after a tiring day in San Francisco. We order the Mysore masala dosa, Pakora, Vada Sambar and Tea. All of them tasted really great. Most of the places serves the masala of the Masala dosa with major portion of potato, but experienced something different here. The masala tasted really great even though it was made with potato. Vada was tasty, so as sambar. Chutneys were not that great, tomato chutney was the best among them. Pakora had a good flavor and tasty. the best among all was the Tea. It wasn't the typical masala tea served in India restaurants. It tasted like the homemade tea. A lot of nice people and smiling faces around too.
author: Jay T.

description:
Hey Girl!
No, it's not Ryan Gosling.

It was just dorky me calling out to my friend who I haven't seen in 8 months as we came here to celebrate her birthday dinner since she spent her real birthday in Switzerland.

Yeah, I was jealous of the Switzerland part too.

My friend really likes the chicken tikka masala here. Think creamy peppercorn sauce and curry and I think you'll have an idea as to why a lot of people like this dish here. I heard somewhere it was rated the best tikka masala in 2014. But, don't quote me on that.

Great with their garlic nan though. Which doesn't have as much butter or is as oily as other places. Their chicken palak (spinach) is lean too with not a lot of heavy cream. Good flavors overall and the meat wasn't dry which is always a good thing.

The chai is $2 and the cup is small, so prepare to get some refills.

So as I was dipping the nan into the mixture of  sauce and chicken on my plate, I handed her her birthday gift.

I'm always stumped as to what to get a girl who isn't your girlfriend. I mean if it's a girlfriend jewelry is so easy to buy, but for the average girl, I'm lost.

So behold the Bath and Body Pumpkin Waffle candle! Because nothing says friendship like the smell of waffles right?!?!

She laughed. 

Thankfully I know she likes candles since her house is filled with them.

I told her I braved Bath and Body works just for her since the scent is so overpowering in that store. Smells like weird vanilla, food, plants, and fresh laundry all blended together.

Almost got a nosebleed spending time in that shop for her gift.

The food here is a bit pricey for the portion, so this is more of a 3.5 rounded up for the service since they are on point with water, boxes, and the check.

Don't worry folks, I picked up the tab of course.
author: Jack R.

description: This is our favorite Indian food in SF! They are always so sweet when they deliver and also in the restaurant. Food is always delicious and consistent! Spices are perfectly balanced and their paneer is quality.
author: staci H.

description: We thought the navratam korma (even though on the sweet side), masala dosa, sambar, onion naan, and chutney were all excellent.
author: Veg V.

description: Pay no attention to the philistines and halfwits that give this gem less than its 5 star due. Masala Dosa serves up top quality dishes, consistently. It is easily the best Indian in the Inner Sunset. Their sauces are big, layered curries with depths to plumb for the thoughtful diner. Their ingredients are very good quality and the results reliably very satisfying. The service is friendly and competent. Try the palak paneer and the mixed tandoori. gd delicious.
author: Striddy B.

description: I don't normally write yelp reviews but I feel the need to here. I ordered through Uber eats and while the delivery was very timely, I feel completely ripped off by the food. The naan tasted like it had been reheated from the day before because it was incredibly chewy and stale. It was difficult for me to tear off a piece. The bottom was also burned. I think this could only be because it was cooked twice. I also didn't taste any basil like advertised. The chicken tikka masala was also overly salted, the amount of salt they used burned my mouth and throat. The yogurt had also begun to curdle, I think that's why they used so much salt, to cover up the spoiling yogurt. My stomach is also beginning to hurt while writing this. They are also skimpy on the chicken, only 6 pieces to be exact. There should be more for the hefty price of $15. After spending a total of $40.39, I feel completely ripped off. The only redeeming item was the mango lassi. This is my second time ordering from here and it will be my last.
author: Christine S.

description:
I'd give four stars for the food, but I have to take away two stars for the service.

The food was very tasty. I ordered a dosa, and the side sauces were delicious. My friend ordered a curry dish, and it was pretty good, too. 

For a place that was not that busy, the servers are not attentive at all. You have to flag them down for anything you need or want - water, utensils, the check...
author: Rachelle M.

description:
I ordered through Yelp. The food took 1 hour 15 minutes to reach even though it's just only 3 blocks away from my place but I couldn't cancel the order once it was placed. 
The food was average at best. Ordered chicken tikka masala and chicken korma which were apparently their most popular choices so i thought it would be safe as it was my first time ordering from them. I felt the chicken was slightly undercooked and the portions were not good considering the price. Since it's one of the few indian places around, I wouldn't whole heatedly recommend it to anyone craving indian food but I would personally avoid it.
author: Shashank G.

description:
Terrible, terrible food. Complete rubbish. The fish Masala Dosa was nothing but Dosa stuffed with plain stir fry fish and potatoes. The sambar was liquidy and the chutney was nothing special. 

As a South Indian, I can say with authority this food is disgusting. 

The service was equally terrible. The waiters are rude.
author: Bindiya T.

description: I've been several times and have loved all of the dishes I've tried. The Dal is my go to with some naan. Their samosas are fantastic, too. Definitely recommend.
author: Mitchell R.

description: Came here with 3 other people and there was only one other group of people in the restaurant. Really great service here. We got two dosas, which were actually HUGE! Like as big as the table... haha. So if your in a group it's fine to just split one. Got the eggplant curry which was very flavorful, garlic nan bread, and chicken tikka masala. Everything was very tasty and we would for sure come back for more. So much on the menu I wanted to try!
author: Hayley D.

description: I'm a fan of the southern Indian foods like dosa, sambar, idly, pakora, etc.  I like Masala Dosa where I can get all of my southern and more common Indian favorites (with more curry).  I ordered the Mysore Masala dosa and the palak paneer.  The dosa was crispy.  Potatoes were perfectly cooked.  The flavor of the dosa filling was delicate compared with the palak paneer which was explosion of flavor.  Great tomato/garlic/ginger chutney and sambar with the dosa.  Restaurant would benefit from a lunch menu.
author: Catherine W.

description: My favorite Indian spot. Fast delivery and an adorable restaurant with sweet staff. I even had my rehearsal dinner here.
author: Rachel L.

description: Too expensive small portion of food and the naan or rice is not included with the entree and like other Pakistani/Indian restaurant. Better hit up shalimar instead
author: Mario L.

description:
I am a frequent customer here and often find myself craving their food! Ive tried just about everything on the menu and highly recommend the dosas, goat cheese stuffed nan, Baigan Bharta, Fish Masala, Fish Vindloo, and Mango Lassi.I have never been disappointed or gone home hungry! 
The customer service is great and you can bring your own bottle and they have no problem with it(:
author: Emma G.

description:
It hurts me to give this place only 3 stars because the food was AMAZING. It was exactly what we were looking for and more than enjoyable. We decided to come here for a birthday dinner and made reservations for 9pm; the guy on the phone said a reservation wouldn't be necessary since they were very busy during that time anyway. The restaurant itself is very pretty and a good place to go for a special meal. 

The only thing that was off about this place was the service. The same guy that seated us was also our waiter. He didn't tend to us very much and we had to call him over to us a couple of times to get his attention. We also didn't get very much water which was an issue only because the food was mildly spicy. At the end of the meal, we were ready to pay with a card and he told us that only that night they were doing cash only. He asked if the guy in the front of the restaurant told us it was cash only which was strange because he was the guy at the front of the restaurant. Anyway, the only one at the table who had cash on him was the birthday boy, so he ended up having to pay for the entire meal! Of course we paid him back, but it was just an awkward and uncomfortable experience which could have easily been avoided with some kind of warning. Regardless of the strange service, I would still go back to this place because it was that delicious.
author: Ren S.

description:
This is the best Indian food my husband and I have found in all of San Francisco. We have only gotten pickup and delivery orders, so I can't speak for inside the restaurant, but I've been super happy with everything so far.

I recommend the palak paneer and the chicken tikka masala. Both are delicious!
author: Daphne W.

description:
Is this supposed to be Indian food?

I spent years working all across India and this resembles nothing I ever tasted or seen.

We ordered delivery food. It was highly reviewed on GrubHub and so we decided to go for it although we ended up spending over $61 for 3 veggi sides (palak paneer, aloo gobi and vegetable Jalfrezi), 1 order of somosas, 2 types of Nan and mango lassi (or so it said)

1) palak paneer = ok

2) aloo gobi = below average and drowning in a tomatoish sauce

3) vegetable (looked more like a pasta tomato sauce) = untouched

4) somosas = it looked and tasted like the Frozen somosas at Trader Joes... Actually those would have been a better choice! What am I saying, potatoes chips from a convenient store would have been a better choice!

5) nan: aloo nan ok - kabuli nan uneatable 

Honestly it was such a disappointment. 
DON'T MAKE OUR SAME MISTAKE!
author: Erica S.

description:
Well, I decided to give it a shot today mainly for a comparison with Moodees an other Indian restaurant which just opened in the same street :). The menu is pretty interesting, you have a large choice of plates. Unfortunately, it's maybe too expensive. I ordered a Chicken Tandoori + rice + a Goat nan (my favorite) = $20. Priceyyy... OK DEAL, that's monday, new week, new things to try, let's taste it. 

The waiter told me that I had to wait 15 min. OK Fine, I was in my neighborhood so I could just walk around. I came back 10 min after. The waiter told me that I had to wait 10 more min.. Ok cool, but I was a bit worried because I was alone in the restaurant. 

Finally I got my plate 30 min after ordering even though I was alone in the restaurant.The server apologized for the delay, I appreciate it, but the conditions to have high prices  are 

1- having a tasty food
2- great place
3- good/fast service . 

The first point is valid, the food was good, not amazing but good. The second too, that's a nice place. Concerning the third one, the server was kind, and apologized but it takes too many time... 

They should change their menu with cheaper prices because since Moodees opened just near (only 50 feet away...), they'd lose a lot of clients.
author: Lino M.

description:
This place is frequented by my friend her family so she took a group of friends here when we visited last week. 

We basically ordered various versions of tikka masala: lamb, chicken, and paneer (my choice). We asked for 4 servings of rice but the waiter quickly recommended we only get 3. We thought he would know best but as it turns out, 4 was definitely the better number and he gave that extra order of rice to us for free!

We also ordered the goat cheese naan and the basil garlic naan. I don't like goat cheese, so I didn't partake but my friends loved it. My basil garlic naan was more basil than garlic but it was a perfect addition to wiping up all that extra curry.

The chicken tikka masala tasted very smoky, in a good way. I don't like lamb so I won't go there. The paneer tikka masala was perfect. 

I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the Golden Gate Park area craving Indian food!
author: Hannah R.

description: Decent Indian food for a reasonable price. The best part is that the food doesn't take that long once you've ordered but name is misleading, sells more Punjabi food than South Indian entrees.
author: Jhankhana J.

description:
Haven't been here in a while but it's still very good! 

We had the samosa, masala dosa, chicken tikka masala, and lamb vindaloo. We also realized about halfway though that maybe we ordered too much food!

Vindaloo was delicious--wish it had more heat though. When I see "spicy" at an Indian restaurant, I expect my mouth to be tingling at the end of the meal. The level of spicy was mild at best but I'll forgive them since their clientele in the inner sunset might not be okay with the real heat.

Service was kind and efficient. We were able to get a table on a Friday night around 930 very easily. 

All in all a great option for dinner in the area. They also stay open fairly late (11pm) for the area.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Really solid neighborhood Indian cuisine. Big fan of the garlic naan and somosas. Nice staff, we normally order pick up and it's always on time!
author: Chris C.

description:
I don't see Yelp messages through my mobile app and was able to check my messages on the website interface for the first time today in years. Been getting a lot of random and nasty messages from business owners and other reviewers who have nothing to do with me, which makes my faith in humanity die a little.

Anyway.

Someone who I think is affiliated with Masala Dosa sent me the following message:

"we don't use MSG.Don't speculate about our restaurant. Get yourself checked from a doctor before eat out."

So I'm updating my review to get the story straight: Masala Dosa does NOT use MSG so that should never be a reason why you don't go there. Some good reasons not to go: their people send me rude messages, their service is slow, their food made me (and my husband!) feel terrible after eating. Guess we both need to see a doctor even though we both eat out plenty and the only shared variable here is eating at Masala Dosa? Hmmm.

I absolutely agree that I shouldn't speculate about the restaurant and should only report what I experienced, which is now described above. However, I don't appreciate whoever messaged me to speculate about my health. There are much better ways to communicate with reviewers who you disagree with and this is not one of them.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I had the worst experience at this place.Service was terrible and moreover they write tip for them selves.Stay away from this place.
author: Venkatesh R.

description:
I rather come here than Naan and Curry down the block.

That said, the Tandoori platter and aloo naan had to be my favorite dishes.  I'm not quite sure what authentic Indian food is b/c I've only been to 3-4 places...  However, this place is good.  It's a bit more expensive than what I'm used to paying for indian,  but I'll still come back.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Meh is my reaction here. 

Came in on a Friday afternoon after getting my nails done. Since mom was craving Indian food (like we don't get enough). 

Saw this place on yelp with good reviews, and dropped in on a completely dead restaurant.

Usually Indian places close during the middle of the day for this reason. 

Order masala dosa, chicken tikka masala, and garlic naan. Staples that I expect to be super yummy and delish.

Masala dosa was alright. No one has been able to beat Vik's masala dosa in my books.

CTM was okay as well. Could have been better. 

Garlic naan needed more garlic. Ugh.

Service should have been impeccable, but it wasn't. disappeared after handing us our food. 

Indian restaurants have sooooooooooooo much potential, but when your lazy and your menu is priced above average, please do us all a favor and ask why your'e open in the first place.
author: Nika K.

description: Delicious well seasoned chicken tandoori breast , well done masala sauce (hence the name of the restaurant lol) and soft tasty naan.. this place is pretty legit , and the mango lassi is a smooth cool drink to wash down the spicy meal.. oh yes it's cash only because the man says credit machine doesn't always work which is fishy because I had him run it and it worked! Coincidence ? Or they are just trying to save money on the transaction ?
author: cristina s.

description:
Possibly our favorite Indian in the city. Definitely our favorite Indian delivery. 

I prefer the chicken makhni over the chicken tikka masala. That makhni is downright addictive! I really enjoy the tikka masala sauce, but don't like the slices of chicken as much as the chunks in the makhni. I should try it with a different protein. I love their paneer and always get either the korma or the matter. The lamb palak is a no brainer; we get it every time. I love the lamb stuffed naan and miss it when we don't get it. Always get extra raita (theirs is the BEST, the one I try to emulate when I make it at home) and pappadum. 

Note: the "Spicy" is good and spicy. "Very Spicy" would probably be great for a few bites, but too much for me for a whole meal. The "Medium" is nothing. Same as the "Mild." Big leap between "Medium" and "Spicy," so they probably switch to a completely different pepper.
author: Veronica L.

description: The servers were very friendly and attentive. The food was also very good and they serve large portions so two people could easily share a bowl of curry. Just note that they charge $2 for a side of rice per person and an order of naan was $2 as well. I will be coming back here again if I am ever craving Indian food!
author: Lynn T.

description: Tried their potato stuffed dosa, a ok. chicken tikka masala is not bad, probably my favorite of the whole meal. And the famous goat cheese naan- I think I prefer the normal naan..there is a thick layer of goat cheese and probably is meant for real goat cheese lovers
author: Sophia H.

description: There food was tasty and authentic. Spices were just right. Had a great time with friends, we were allowed to bring in our 6 pack of beer which was awesome. Service couldn't of been better. Would recommend to anyone
author: Kevin F.

description: Authentic albiet simple cuisine, very empty on a weekday at lunch time.  Dishes cost about $12-17, even at lunch.  They should consider doing a lunch special to get people in the door!
author: M S.

description:
Ordered food to go from this place. The chicken tikka masala didn't taste right...the sauce was bland and looked diluted, and the chicken was dry. The naan didn't taste fresh and was not crunchy at all. The food here is over priced and the wait is way too long for what you get. Customer service was slow and the estimated wait for the food ended up being almost double the time. Not worth it. If you're near this restaurant and want Indian food then go to Naan and Curry a few blocks away.

FYI...health score here is 86 out of 100...

Violations

    Moderate risk food holding temperature
    Unapproved or unmaintained equipment or utensils
    Low risk vermin infestation
    Inadequately cleaned or sanitized food contact surfaces
    Unclean or degraded floors walls or ceilings
author: Mike W.

description:
Always a fan of Indian food and this place could not be more authentic and well represented of Indian food. The restaurant is located in area with many other food choices so I come to this area quite often. Parking can be difficult at times since it is mainly meter close by and is a very busy area, especially at nights and during the weekends.

Food is of decent portion for the price. Their curries are spot on! Seasoning is on point and is not overly salted with just the right amount of flavorings that represent Indian cuisine. My favorites include tikka masala and the aloo matar, so yummy! Usually my boyfriend and I get two curried and one nan but the tandoori chicken is also awesome! I highly recommend trying those dishes. One nan is served in four pieces so the portion is good to share between two people. Highly recommend the garlic and basil nan, our favorite :)
author: Wendy Z.

description:
This place is an excellent option for those with gluten free needs. The food is really, really good, and gluten free options --which is *most* of the menu-- are very clearly marked. 

We had the chicken biryani and the sheek kebab uthappam. The chicken was super tender and juicy, and the rice was fragrant and delicious. The uthappam was super good. We can't wait to have leftovers tomorrow :)

5 stars, keep it up!
author: Brent S.

description: I ordered Masala dosa, my friend ordered Chicken Tika masala, my food came 10 minutes before his food was served, my dosa was ok, but Sambar was cold, they heated up in the microwave & when I tasted it, i could tell it was cooked several days ago not fresh at all, it didn't taste anything like Sambar or even look like Sambar, I told the waiter to tell the chef if he is going to work in a restaurant called Masala Dosa, may be he or she should learn how to cook Sambar. Needless to say the worst Sambar I ever had. Waiter was real nice though. I would never go in there again, not for Masala Dosa anyway.
author: Angie M.

description:
This is a solid 4 star Indian restaurant! 

If you are okay with shedding out a couple of more dollars for quality than Masala Dosa is the place for you! This is not your ordinary cafeteria style/buffet restaurant. I love those types of Indian restaurants for the sake of affordable prices and a full stomach. However, sometimes you just wanna treat yourself! At about $20 a person, my boyfriend and I had a delicious meal that included: Tandoori Chicken, Prawn Tikka Masala, Naan, Basmati Rice, and Chai Tea. Not to mention, a bottle of CAB SAV free of corkage fee! Yes, you heard it right! No corkage fee! (A rarity in San Francisco restaurants.) 

The Tandoori Chicken is served on a piping hot plate with green peppers and onions sizzling away. It's gotta be one of the best Tandoori Chicken dishes I've ever had! This is a must try for all you chicken lovers out there! 

Prawn Tikka Masala was flavorful and was not overbearingly spicy. Smother that curry sauce over the rice and you got yourself, heaven in your mouth. (Shout out to Stephen Curry! Go Warriors! #WeBelieveChampionship2015. I'm going off tangent, but the Bay Area is just on this Warriors high that there are so many Indian curry references to Steph Curry. I just had to say it!) 

Naan was where I took one star off. I ordered the Garlic Naan and was expecting a fluffy, doughy, and flavorfully (hehehe -__-) side of bread. However, I barely tasted the garlic, the bottom had a burnt hue, and it was crisp thin. It's a bit surprising, because the last time I ordered their special, Naan filled with goat cheese and cranberry sauce which by the way was amazing, was fluffy, doughy, and flavorfully. It wasn't a deal breaker, but I think I'll pass on ordering the Garlic Naan next time. 

Moving on, I just wanted to point out that the promotional video on their Yelp page was personal and heartfelt. (Click play if you haven't already!) I definitely sensed the family oriented aura that filled the room. The customer service is spot and they really care that you have the best experience when dining at their restaurant. Going along with their value of family, the women's bathroom has a baby changing table! Not that many restaurants offer this! It's the little things that count and Masala Dosa does a great job in accommodating their customers' needs.
author: Briana H.

description:
My cousin loves Indian food but he's never had a dosa before, so this was the obvious place to eat after a visit to the DeYoung.

We wanted to start with the Bombay (squid) Pakora, but they were out. Automatic one star deduction. So we went with the regular (spinach and onion) Pakora instead. Then we ordered the Chicken Masala Dosa and Lamb Korma.  Rice and naan were not included, so we had to order that too.

The Pakora was excellent.  It arrived hot and crispy. The tamarind sauce made it taste even better.  I wanted to eat another piece because it tasted so good, but I was afraid of ruining my lunch.  

Next came the Chicken Masala Dosa. It was light, crispy, with an ample amount of small bits of chicken inside. My cousin liked it. I liked it a lot, but I think I like the Mushroom Masala Dosa better.  

The Lamb Korma was excellent.  Nice meaty, boneless hunks of lamb in a creamy sauce. The sauce paired perfectly with the garlic basil naan.

Prices are about what you would expect for San Francisco. Service was good, my water glass was refilled as quickly as I emptied it.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description: THE Best Indian food I've had in a long time. I've ordered a few different dishes from this place that were great,  but I recently ordered the lamb korma and it was so tasty ! Definitely recommend this place.
author: Eoin O.

description:
This is my favorite Indian food place in all of SF. It's a small-medium quaint restaurant with really nice people working there. There is a seating section of the restaurant that is elevated by the window. It's very cozy and has pillows for you to put behind your back.

The food is AMAZING. My boyfriend and I have been coming here for 5 years. I didn't even like Indian food before. 

The menu and especially the appetizers are very unique...thing like lentil "donuts" and onion fritter dipped in chickpea batter (everything labeled gluten free)....LOVE the salmon tandori and also all the veggie curries with paneer especially paneer-cashew one!

It's really very good and so underrated. I can't believe this place doesn't have a following!!! Most underrated restaurant in SF by far.
author: Larissa M.

description:
Health inspection:  85 out of 100 points ?  Yikes !  No wonder my stomach did the tango after a dosa last week.   Any scores below 92 - avoid!   A few minor infractions are ok, but below 92 we are talking about critters and crud that's too gross to discuss . . . .

The dosa had good flavor, but I'll not go back.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Food taste was below average and it is not very authentic. Tried briyani which, was not that great, tasted like tamarind rice. Idly was also not up to the level. Chutneys were not fresh. As the other place "curry village" has been closed people are left out with only two options now in inner sunset. One of them is this place. Fall of Curry Village has became a boon for masala dosa. People who come looking for curry village end up going here after learning that the other one has been closed a while ago.
author: Devan K.

description: Ambiance is fine, sat in the window table. They dont have a beer/liquor license so they recommend you to pop next door to the grocery to grab a six pack. They did nicely store the beer in the fridge for us. Appreciated. Papadums were stale. Masala sauce was watery, not spicy AT ALL and too sweet for my preference. My friend got one of the spinach lamb curries and liked his. His was the only "thick" curry on the table, probably because of the spinach. Naan was less than average. Had much better indian, so lackluster that I wouldn't return.
author: Anna M.

description:
Addictin' chicken. Frickin' addictin' chicken korma.

I won't deny that the prices are a bit steep. But, the steep prices are validated: Masala Dosa is staged as a higher-end Indian restaurant than Curry Village or Naan N' Curry, so, adjust your expectations accordingly.

(PASS ON THE) $6 EGGPLANT PAKORA: fresh eggplant dipped in chick pea batter and fried (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/masala-dosa-san-francisco?select=DJUKjAUgUbAZnjxp6gxe-A#DJUKjAUgUbAZnjxp6gxe-A)
- This dish ain't my piece o' cake. It's like the Indian version of tempura, except the chick pea batter isn't fried to a crisp, which leaves the pakora somewhat soggy. Add that to the flavorless nature of eggplant, and you're left with something mushily tasteless. Albeit, the mint chutney and sweet tamarind sauces are delicious and are meant to deliver a large component of flavor, but then I might as well just lap up those bowls of sauce. As if I don't already do that, haaaa. Shhhhhh.

(OMG YOU BETTER GET THE) $13 CHICKEN KORMA: tandoori chicken cooked in a clay oven stewed in a cashew cream sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/masala-dosa-san-francisco?select=3cMzA8dlGFoRpmONh_ymOQ#3cMzA8dlGFoRpmONh_ymOQ)
- Ridic delish. You should order this. And then, you should order this again. Yes, $13 is a bit of moolah for a dish that's usually less than $10, but just play some mind games and tell yourself it's $12.99 instead.
- The bowl is small. Well, that's probably a mind game too. I bet it's actually the same size since the food is served in a normal bowl rather than those typical flat saucer dishes. Despite the small bowl, there's a heckuva lot of tandoori chicken chunks--I would say 8 or 9. And that beautifully moist chicken is what makes this dish addictive. This is most definitely the moistest chicken I've ever had in an Indian dish. And it doesn't help that the cashew cream sauce is liquid crack.

(IF YOU WANNA, GET THE) $12 CHICKEN MASALA DOSA (dosas not available through online ordering): thin crepe with potatoes and chicken (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/masala-dosa-san-francisco?select=jYk3XRjZMohJGoKUUav3kg#T4Wfxp2FcovJNI19V75K7g)
- The crepe is huge--3/4 the length of my entire arm huge--with a thin layer of chicken masala spread on it. It's served with sambar (a comforting chickpea soup spiced with tamarind) and chutneys (the cilantro-cucumber one was intriguing), as well as a small dish of tikka masala sauce (tomatoes, garlic, and Indian spices). Geez, that tikka masala sauce is bomb, so much so that I asked for a second serving (the server recommended it a bit warmed for more impactful flavor). Slurpity slurp slurp.
- I can't quite figure out why the chicken in the dosa isn't as juicy as the chicken in the korma, since both use tandoori chicken. My guess is that the chicken in the korma is stewed in the cream sauce, which maintains moisture better.

(PROBS SHOULD HAVE SOME) $3 GARLIC BASIL NAAN: baked bread with garlic and basil (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/masala-dosa-san-francisco?select=3cMzA8dlGFoRpmONh_ymOQ#pi0Mr3dLe0k3kh52SDwP3w)
- The naan here is thin crust pizza-esque rather than fluffy, which lends more of a crunch. Enjoyed the generous seasoning.

My recommendation: skip everything else on their menu and hone in on just the chicken korma. That frickin' addictin' chicken korma.
author: Adele F.

description: There are so many Indian Restaurants in town to compare... I would say this one in top 10% for Sunset District. Price range is definitely appealing, service is fast enough, quality of food is average to good.  Overall , given the convenient location I'm giving solid 4 stars
author: Leo S.

description:
I never write reviews. I just think this is needed for anyone who uses Postmates. 

Postmates doesn't give a rating system through their app. I wish they would have. 

I honestly have had better Indian food after the bars close in the marina (really, there is a good Indian street vendor on Filmore). The chicken tikka masala I got was the worst I've had in my life. The chicken looked/tasted like something you'd find in a Lunchable box or a elementary school frozen lunch box. The chicken wasn't natural, it definitely was processed (not being a snob, I just mean that it didn't come directly from the bird. Additional processing has been done to form it into something that looks like chicken). 

I won't order again, but if you are completely drunk, out of food and they are the only restaurant open, or you don't have taste buds, I highly recommend this place.
author: Daniel O.

description:
I gave it one star just so I can write a review. Also, the waiters were pleasant.

But, the food. Gee...

We went here because of the reviews. The food tasted like someone made the meal from scratch using inedible ingredients- the Dosas and vadas and sambar were the worst I've ever had in my six decades of life- bar none.

Can't speak to their North Indian menu- I didn't try it.

But, please, no South Indian food. I'd hate for a first time patron to leave disappointed with the cuisine. 

The owners ought to rename this restaurant. Calling it masala dosa is an insult.

If you are looking for decent South Indian food , pl  look elsewhere.
author: thaila r.

description:
real bad indian food. This is not south Indian food and bad food. I am south Indian and i know this is not a good food. They take cash. I suspect that too... they dont split bills, WATCH OUT FOR THIS PLACE. Stale food, this place doesn't know Indian food. We were 3 and asked for split bills and waiter said he gives only one. Something fishy.
They microwave food. I doubt id they report their earnings.

THEY ARE DISGRACE FOR GREAT INDIAN FOOD.
author: Bhargava G.

description:
Wanted Indian for dinner. Since we never order Indian delivery, my roommate did some yelping and decided on Masala Dosa. It's on the expensive side for Indian food, but we had a 20% off living social code, so we went for it.

I loved the Tandoori chicken! I had been turned off by the last couple of tandoori dishes I had since they were super dry and almost inedible unless massive amounts if curry topped the meat. But this one was supermoist and had that nice charred taste to it. I would order this again in a heartbeat!

Now for the lowlight of the meal. The dosa. So I've never had a dosa, but the restaurant has dosa in the name, so I thought I'd try it. It should be good right? Huge mistake! I'm not sure if they're supposed to be eaten right away, so delivery probably did the dish an injustice, but it was a floppy mushy mess. The crepe got steamed in the packaging so it was really mushy. Plus the crepe to filling ratio was off. I just didn't enjoy this dish at all.

The rest of the dishes were okay. Good and bad points to all. I guess my main complaint was flavor and spice. I liked the two vindaloos we had, but they both could have benefited from a little more spice. The biryani and tikka masala were both kind of bland and lacking in the extra punch of flavor to make them great!

All in all an okay meal. But I'm definitely going to have to try a dosa again. They can't actually be what I got for delivery last night. But thank you Masala Dosa for making me love Tandoori chicken again!
author: Elena N.

description: The food was tasty and delivery was rather quick. However, I was disappointed to find out that my lamb with bell peppers dish had 5 tiny pieces of lamb and the rest was a huge load of onions in the sauce. I didn't see a single bell pepper, unless they were all blended in the sauce, then it was unclear from the description. Again, the flavor was good, but lackluster on the meat amount.
author: Tanya T.

description:
This is a private message written to my by the owner:
"your message is as stupid as it can be. Everything we serve to a customer has a cost. In your case you asked for a chicken tikka masala sauce and the waiter charge you $6. I don't understand whats the big deal about it. you paid $6 not $6000. We don't even serve chicken tika masala sauce alone.If you are that cheap why you go to a restaurant. This is San Francisco everything is expensive here, this is not some cheap small town."
author: Andrew K.

description: Really enjoyed our takeout meal here. We ordered naan, bhindi masala (okra), and lamb seekh kabob. The okra was SO GOOD! Not sticky at all and very fresh. It was a bit on the greasy side but easily remedied by pouring off the oil. The naan was fresh and perfectly textured. The kabobs were my favorite. Yes they were a bit pricey but you could see where the kabob skewers went through the formed kabobs, indicating authenticity in terms of cooking methods. The lamb tasted fresh and was well spiced. I wish it came with raw rather than cooked onions but it didn't deter from the experience. We'll definitely be back to try some of the South Indian specialties!
author: Veda R.

description:
Wow, wow, wow! And that doesn't begin to describe how much I enjoyed tonight's dinner delivery. I've eaten Indian food from LA to SF and I have to say hands down this has to be the best Tandoori Chicken I've ever had!!!! 

I ordered delivery from Grubhub and everything arrived well packed. I've eaten a lot of dried out Tandoori Chicken in my day but this chicken was moist and so flavorful. The rice was tasty and I even tried their tomato soup which was just absolutely divine with the naan bread. I'm definitely a fan

The delivery guy was very friendly too. Only problem I had was there were no utensils in the bag or condiments. Luckily I had some with me while traveling. I'll definitely have to visit again soon and so should you!
author: Melonie R.

description: This was my first time ordering, but everything was delicious. I had the chicken tikka masala and the palak paneer with rice and regular naan. Delivery was fast and the driver was very nice. I will definitely order from here again!
author: Sheri B.

description: Ordered online from their website link in google search. Masala dosa refused to honor the order saying that I had to cancel with the online service and pay them directly. I now have to dispute the charge via my bank. Nightmare.
author: Kate B.

description:
Clean bathrooms, cool window seating and fire place decor. Great service and enjoyed the cardamom rice pudding !

Friend said that he had had everything he ordered before at different places; and slightly better then--Nothing to complain about it
author: Alexander T.

description:
I ordered a Chicken Masala dosa for takeout.  Once I opened it, it smelled and tasted burnt.  This was an obvious candidate for a do-over!

Chicken was dry and the overall flavor was just meh.  The accompaniments barely improved the taste.  Sad mouth.  Meh.

Too bad because I've been wanting to try this place for a while.

Next time I'll just trek to Dosa in the Mission.
author: Timan G.

description:
Worst food ever! My mom came to San francisco for first time and we planned to have lunch around and found out this restaurant on the way! We ordered panner tikka masala and malai kofta and both had same gravy colors! Both taste same just that paneer and kofta were an add on!
On complaining about it, we got a negative reply and the owner was not friendly at all! In fact he made a racist comment on customers. Owner should know the value of its customers! He also threatened to call cops and remove us out for just complaining about their food..
Totally non deserving!
I suggest all of them to never go this place! Even if this is the last restaurant on earth and you are dying! I will prefer dying!
author: Mohit G.

description:
I so wanted to like Masala Dosa, and have it be our Sunset go-to for Indian. But everything we had last night was pretty bland, the chicken in the tikka masala wasn't melt in your mouth like at Golden Gate Indian Cuisine & Pizza out on Judah. 

The garlic naan certainly needed more garlic, as others have noted. Will keep looking around for the PERFECT Indian spot in the hood....and most likely keep heading to Udupi Palace on Valencia for dosas par excellence and Golden Gate for proximity...
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
The food is below average. The Garlic Naan for some reason were doused in turmeric and chewy. The curries too hot and spicy when we had specifically requested for mild spice and less oil. The service was snail pace even though the restaurant had only two other guests. People who arrived way after us were served before. 

We requested for a few slices of onion and lemon and were promptly told it'll be $3 extra ( it's complimentary in all other Indian restaurants in the city). Curiously enough though the server hustled back after sometime and places a plate of lemon/ onion with a wink (yes we tipped well). 

Strange sleepy restaurant. Don't go if you have other options.
author: Nutcrackin C.

description:
I ordered delivery and was surprised given some of the negative reviews here. 
Delivery was when they said it would be and the order was correct.
Samosas -  crispy and not oily/tough
Chana Masala - very flavorful and just right amount of spice
Dal Soup - good and came piping hot
Naan - a little heavy, but better than average for delivery

Overall - solid 4 stars
author: Layne M.

description: 3 hungry friends after a long walk in Golden Gate park found ourselves in this restaurant around 3:45 PM. We ordered lamb rogan josh, chicken tikka masala and vegetable biryani. Chicken tikka masala was pieces of chicken (not thoroughly cooked) floating in a very thin masala. Very flavorless. The lamb dish was not impressive at all. The biryani was the highlight of the orders and thank god the portion was enough for 3 of us. Service was inattentive. He forgot a spoon and put a tea spoon in the rice dish! (How am i supposed to serve rice with a teaspoon? Maybe a good tool to control your carb intake). We had to ask for water each time and even though there were 2 tables filled at the time- he got us a doggies bag (which was actually for the table next to us).
author: Megan K.

description: This is my go-to spot for take-out Indian. The dishes are generously spiced and flavorful without feeling too heavy. Delivery has been prompt and friendly. I dined in one time, and the service was excellent, too! It's not super fancy, but it has been consistently good.
author: Patricia D.

description: The customer service was very friendly. The food was very tasty especially nom veg items
author: Salman K.

description:
How many places in San Francisco can you BYOB?! This is a rare find. You can bring in your own wine (no corkage) or beer. And there's a nice corner store down the street with a very good selection, very convenient. 

The food is great! Everything we ordered was flavorful, but the dosas shouldn't be missed-savory crepes with delicious flavors-think a refined version of a Curry Up Now. Add to that, a classy ambience-tastefully decorated with nice touches. Menu items are reasonably priced. And it's away from the main stretch on ninth, a bit out of the way, so you don't have to fight for a table.
author: Lisa N.

description: Extremely disappointed, given how high all the other reviews of this restaurant are. I ordered the chicken korma medium spicy and it tasted like thick flavorless gravy. The consistency and color were like pale orange baby food, and the chicken was tough. It was so unappetizing that my friend and I couldn't finish our meal. I'm not sure if something happened to the menu between when we ordered and when the rest of these reviews were written, or if we came on an off night, but this was truly awful. I never write yelp reviews, but this warranted it.
author: Maddy H.

description: Great service and very clean and friendly! We ordered paneer tikka masala and a palak (spinach) dish with rice and naan: excellent food!
author: Allyson G.

description:
The tandoori chicken was the best I've ever had. Big and juicy, so fresh! The service was great and the decor was nicely done, very cozy. 
I'm not usually a chai person but I thought there's was very nice. The samosas were stuffed full. Very generous portion.
author: Tara Y.

description:
I was never a big fan of Indian cuisine after experiencing Naan & Curry (on Irving St) and House of Curries (in Berkeley). I reluctantly came to Masala Dosa with my sister, believnig that I would never like Indian food. 

Here comes my epiphany! Masala Dosa was a gem! I was feeling adventurous, so I ordered a chai tea. It looked very creamy, and I added a pack of sugar. The chai was A-MAZING. It was light and smooth, with a hint of chai, but not too sweet and sugary -- not like those chai lattes you get from Starbucks. All chai teas should taste like the ones from Masala.

My sister was set on ordering the Chicken Tikka Masala and garlic naan, so I decided to be adventurous again and we ordered the Baigan Bharta -- fresh mesquite eggplant with ginger, garlic and spices. The eggplant went well with the naan, and I could taste the ginger and garlic, but it wasn't overwhelming either. The chicken in the tikka masala was so tender, a stark contrast from the tough chicken I had to chew and swallow from the chicken tikka masala at House of Curries. 

Though the portions looked small, three items was filling for three people. If you are eating with someone else, I recommend ordering 3 items if you are very hungry, and 2 items if you're not as hungry. The chai tea is a must!

Overall, I was impressed with Masala, so this place will be my new favorite for now.
author: Joanne K.

description:
I could probably make better dosas if i tried hard enough.
everything we got was either overcooked or burnt.
and the chunteys weren't even fresh.
big disappointment!
author: Namrata J.

description:
Poor service, I had to request for water thrice until I got one.
We had 2 vegetarian entrees and it was just ok. Garlic Naan was not good enough.
author: Sahil S.

description: Prices are little expensive for this restaurant, but understandable since Indian food is one of the most complex cuisines to make (trust me I've slaved away making it). Their Tikka masala, Gobi Aloo, and chana masala does not disappoint. The only flaw is that they make you order through an online service, not even accepting phone orders. This is of the most inconvenience, and should be remedied.
author: Lynn E.

description:
Pros: Decor is nice.

Cons: Service, food, and atmosphere well below standard.  Food was overcooked, drastically underspiced and overpriced.  Service untrained and unresponsive. 

Despite the name 'Masala,' there was little spice, almost no salt, and conspicuously absent chilis in the flavoring of the dishes. Portion sizes very small, though with such poor-quality preparation, it was just as well.  We arrived hungry and left much of what we'd ordered on the table. 

This seems to be a delivery service with a nearly-empty restaurant. There were intermittent long waits for food because the kitchen was doing a busy delivery business.

We joined a party in progress - two of us had arrived 30 minutes early, so they had ordered some appetizers - and then waited 15 minutes after arrival to get menus, and then waited about 20 more minutes for the 'waiter' to take our order.  'Waiter' because the young man waiting on us seemed completely inexperienced at serving, delivering dishes, answering questions, etc.  Once he arrived with a dish, he'd disappear into the back, or lounge at the hostess stand.

Onion naan was dry to the point of being less edible than the cardboard that it resembled. I've never had bad naan in a restaurant, and this seemed stale, as if it had been sitting out overnight rather than cooked to order. It was essentially snapping-stale flatbread painted with turmeric, no oil, and apparently dried scallions.  Hungry as I was, I couldn't eat more than a few bites.

The 'Maysore' (not 'Mysore') dosa was drastically overcooked, with the outer 4" of the wrapper the color of burnt toast.  Though I'd ordered it extra spicy, a two-year-old could have eaten the sparse potato filling without a whimper.

Bhindi (okra) curry was underseasoned, with sparse, stale spices and no fire whatsoever.The bhindi themselves were al dente, and dripping with ghee.

Salmon curry was OK, though like everything, completely devoid of heat, but I doubt very much that at that price point it was really wild salmon, as listed on the menu. Tasted and looked like decent farmed salmon.

Sambar was so underspiced that it indeed seemed, as noted by another reviewer, to be more dhal than sambar.

Pickles and chutneys were fine. 

Our hapless waiter had to be nudged for any attention that we needed - more chai, menus, etc.  Between our arrival  and the appearance of our food, they ran out of chai and we had to remind him after 30 minutes that we still had not received the requested refill.
author: Shoshi D.

description: I go here for the Chicken Madras. It's mild but flavorful and the chicken is super tender.  Also tried the Lamb Vindaloo. The meat is tender, not stringy or fatty. I've dined in and had delivery. Service is good, staff is extremely attentive.
author: Kristen P.

description:
This turned out to be a surprisingly great place to bring toddler twin boys. We were having a late lunch and the only other people initially were families with young kids, too. We were in the window bench seat, and one twin wandered on it while the other played with the centerpiece, a tray of sand and zen rocks.  Every time a muni train went by on 9th Avenue, they shouted "choo-choo"  (they haven't quite mastered "light rail" yet)  The food too is great --  they gave us the kebab dosa by accident but it was delicious, as was the lamb tikka masala.  Pakora a bit greasy, but I suppose you know what you're getting into when you order it.  The goat cheese, cranberry and cinnamon naan seemed doughy to me but the boys loved it. Which is who ordered it for, anyway.

Kids or no kids, give it a try!
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Pros: fried idly was average and tasted like it should have. Their chutney (green coconut) was tasty and so was the red chutney. Sambhar was bearable (had all the salt that the cook missed in the dosas). Friendly service.

Cons: Mysore masala dosa - tasteless. Though crispy, this was perhaps the worst dosa I've ever had. Egg masala dosa, same deal - tasteless and at the bottom of my list. Ghee idly dipped in Sambhar had me almost puke. Pricey indeed.

Any Dosa or Idly cannot have me complain, but this just beat that record.
author: Rishi P.

description: Masala Dosa is consistently delicious.  Their Chicken Korma is creamy, flavorful. I love both their tomato and lentil soups, and can also recommend the Palak Paneer (spinach and cheese), garlic Nan (flatbread), and many other dishes.  I've never had a bad item from their wide menu.  Delivery is timely and gracious and the restaurant is friendly.  Absolutely yummy.
author: Betty K.

description:
The initial smell when you come in is a smokey burnt something. Slightly off putting when it looks like people are avoiding this place. I ordered the masala dosa, chicken korma, basil garlic naan and garlic naan. 

The service was very nice. We were one of the 2 couples that were eating lunch there. 

I liked that they had a variety of South Indian options and wanted to try them all, however my friend wasn't familiar with South Indian eats. Yelp said the chicken korma and garlic basil naan was the thing to order. I'd say the soda is the thing to order. There is just enough potato filling for the entire crepe. The sauces were good and sambur is really good. I'd come back for a dosa fix. Of course it's not as good as Pune's Vaishali, still good enough. 

If you are looking for a great naan place, I wouldnt say this should be your destination.
author: Christina L.

description: My husband and I have gone here several times when we're in San Francisco and absolutely love it!! Great service and very authentic Indian food. We really love the naan and lentil donuts!! Yum!!
author: MaryAnne P.

description:
You know when you walk into a restaurant and all the people dining there are Indian...you have made a good call.

Don't get me wrong Dosa on fillmore is my number one Indian restaurant...but Masala Dosa puts up a tough fight and is really good.

I love their chicken vindaloo, masala dosa, basil garlic naan, and their curries. Yes portions are not large....but they are good and moderately priced. Also their rice is lovely: Flavorful and delicate.

All dishes are authentic and full of flavor...only downside was that the masala Dosa was served cold...it must have sat there before they served it.

Ambiance is okay. Location is okay....parking off of 9th in the inner sunset is basically a travesty...but not impossible.

3.5 stars for this nice little restaurant.
author: David G.

description: 3.5 stars, rounding up. We had a pretty good meal here... The restaurant itself is small but nicely decorated. We had reservations and were seated after a few minutes wait, but it wasn't a busy day. We enjoyed the pumpkin dosa, idly, chicken korma, tandoori chicken, and the vegetable jalfrezi. The naan wasn't our favorite and truth be told we're still kinda feeling the meal a day later (it was quite heavy), but all-in-all a good experience. We'd go back if we were in the neighborhood.
author: Art C.

description:
We were craving some good Indian food. Both my roommate and I have spent time in India and been to Dosa on Fillmore. Figured a 4 star review on Yelp was worth trying out. We ordered:
- Chicken Tikka Masala
- Jheenga Masala
- Garlic naan
- Poori
- Onion and chili uthapam

We waited 1 hour 15 minutes for it to be delivered (live 1 mile away). The bill was $48 and the delivery guy gave me the smallest bag of food imaginable for the bill. I even asked him if they missed anything and he reassured me that everything was delivered. Of course, the Naan and Poori were missing once we opened the bag. We called them and was told to wait another hour for the naan to be delivered. Then we tasted the chicken tikka masala which tastes NOTHING like chicken tikka masala, more like a sweet barbecue sauce satay. Finally, the onion and chili uthapam turned out to be their Paneer and Pea uthapam.

We called again and they told us thats the way chicken tikka masala is supposed to taste, and that onion and chili uthapam is SUPPOSED to have paneer and pea and not onion and chili. 

No discount on total bill, overall food quality D-, customer service F, one of the most frustrating experiences I have ever had.
author: Bowen J.

description:
I have eaten at Masala Doaa twice and ordered take out once. My partner who lived in India for five years loved the food the first time, finding it authentic and well balanced. The second time, however, we received food with exactly the same sauce for a different menu item. Items were also too salty. 
When I ordered for delivery which is listed as a service online, the people on the phone were grumpy and said "only if you really need it."
The atmosphere and decor is nice, and the food tastes good, but it's not really worth more than one visit.
author: Allxie C.

description:
Listen carefully. This is my first post EVER on yelp. it takes a lot for me to waste my time doing this. But I can't let this go.

Worst indian food EVER. Period.
author: Leo D.

description:
I found several strands of hair in their food! WHAT?!  So disgusting.  I really loved this place and the server and manager denied that it was from their kitchen staff.  WHAT again?!  it was very sad because I have been going to this place for many years, and to have that thrown into our faces was shocking!  

On another occasion, I was extremely disappointed in the delivery service (or lack thereof) the last time I was at Masala Dosa.  I tried to order delivery and the person stated that it was too far.  Now, I have ordered more than two dozen times and have had no issues with deliveries.  What changed? The server taking orders on the phone tried to blame the "new" guy for making the mistakes.  A person is not so new if they've been there for over 6 months.  What is going on with this restaurant?

I am very sad to see the decline in service.  I did really enjoy this restaurant.  Hopefully, they errors will be corrected.  Bye bye, Masala Dosa.

Until then I will have to find a more clean and honest Indian restaurant.  

Any suggestions???
author: Mac D.

description:
A horrible horrible place. I would give it -ve stars if there was an option.

We were 2 Indians who came here and we were greeted fine. When we asked for straws, he gave just one.
Then, they went on to ask
author: Maya A.

description: The place was empty except one other couple, and the more time we spent here--and we spent a long time--the more obvious the reason for the emptiness. First, incredbily poor service. We waited 30 min for a platter of fried calamari, and after asking, the guy came over and said they were still frozen. We said, there is no need to bring out the calamari, please bring the main dishes. 15 more minutes and one entree came out, 15 min later the unfrozen calamari, and 15 min after that the second entree came out. The taste was Americanized Indian food, to give it a better description than it deserves. If you are not particular about Indian food, take out seems the way to go, but with so many choices really why waste your money. And your time.
author: Chou K.

description: Very flavorful goat cheese naan & chicken tikka masala!! They are open late until 11 and the portions are just the right amount. This is a good place to have some hearty Indian cooking with plenty of flavor.
author: Jackie G.

description: Place was pricey for what was delivered and the food was extremely salty. Everything was made with seemingly old ingredients that were over cooked. I wanted to like it, I love indian food but unfortunately would not order from them again.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
I get my Indian fix here!  Food is great, interior is clean but the service can be hit or miss.

I've had most of their dishes and it's all great.  There are a few dishes I repeat time and time over:  Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Vindaloo and Baigan Bharta.  I usually ask for the lamb vindaloo extra spicy!

They don't have their drink license so we usually walk up the block and pick up some beer to enjoy with our dinner.
author: Susan C.

description: Got the lamb and chicken curry. Sauce was thin and runny, the curry flavor was pretty basic. Nothing earth shattering. Will not be ordering from here again.
author: Daisy B.

description:
Bumping up this restaurant with an extra star after my recent visit.

We decided to give this restaurant another try because we were craving South Indian food in the sunset. We tried the Masala Dosas again, and something just wasn't right. Authentic dosas (the kinds they serve elsewhere) are nearly fried in oil. Thats how they are crispy, golden brown and so tasty. The ones in this restaurant were really low on the grease. So the taste and texture was different. 

We spoke to owners to figure it out the discrepancy. The owner said, that the restaurant was geared towards non-Indians who prefer the low-oil, low-spice version. So if you want the unhealthy real deal, this may not be a big hit.
author: Maneesh S.

description:
This was for a take our order, Visiting from NY where things are just as expensive as SF, however, you can find a reasonably priced Indian joint all over Manhattan. This wasn't super overpriced but the food is mediocre at best. The Chicken tiki masala was mostly sauce, the shag was okay (Lamb, they said they had no beef...really) 
My fault for ordering Poori bread out, I usually don't order Indian food out, the poori was flat...my fault. Some of the other dishes were okay, the rice was so-so, all in all it was fine, nobody got sick that's a plus. I think the rating is a 3-.
author: Bill F.

description: Tasteless food. Tiny portions. Expensive. At least the music isn't loud. Really, this is the worst Indian food either of us had ever had. Sad! We had wanted it to be a special night
author: Lang N.

description:
Definitely have had ALOT better. Ordered Sunday delivery dinner, order took about an hour and was completely COLD. 

The cold factor is not a big deal as we can easily heat things up. But the food was not good at all. We ordered the tandoori mix, saag paneer, chicken tiki masala, rice and a plain and garlic naan. The saag paneer was the only decent dish in the order. The tiki masala was incredibly salty. Everything else was so bland. Plain and garlic naan both tasted the same, flat. All the meats were dry and overcooked. 

Total miss. Bf and I each had a plate of food and tossed the rest. Wasn't even worth saving it for leftovers. Will go back to Great India for the usual delivery order as their service is ridiculously fast and food very tasty
author: Pauline T.

description:
Please. Do yourself a favor and go to Dosa or Udupi instead for your dosa needs.

It makes me angry this restaurant has such a high rating, considering the dosa is just so, so awful. I have fairly low standards when it comes to dosa, since I love it in any form, but this is just terrible. Don't do this to yourself.
author: Suchitha S.

description:
Super good food, very friendly staff, and an easy location to walk to from my friend's apartment.  

I had the pakora, pappadums, tandoori chicken, and rice with a side of raita.  SO good.  My friend ordered the paratha, chicken korma, and rice.  We both really enjoyed our food, the serving sizes were perfect, leaving me plenty for leftovers for dinner tonight.

As someone who is allergic to gluten, I also really appreciated the labeling of specific dishes as gluten free.  I tend to gravitate towards Indian food anyway, since it's mostly gluten free, and Masala Dosa was definitely worth it.
author: Ann-Marie H.

description:
Service is nothing great. You have to ask for water (which actually is a good water-saving tactic considering most places will unnecessarily continue to refill your glass whether you'd like water or not). We had the dahi vada to start which was very filling but a bit lukewarm. Taste was decent. Masala dosa was a tad dry. However, the chutneys were pretty good (even if there's only two that come with it) and they're quite mild. Sambar was surprisingly good, but there's not too many ways you can fuck up sambar.
The atmosphere is strangely modern, dark and up-scale. 

Overall, get ready for minimalist decor along with minimalist service. Food is decent but overpriced for the quality.
author: Liz R.

description: We visited here before & were pretty impressed, but last night was honestly a let down. We both grew up in the UK so have had our fair share of Indian food & this was - frankly - average at best. They had no veg pakoras, and yet the table next to us had chicken pakora which suggests to me things are pre-made which is a real shame. The food needs more spice and flavor and the portions were fairly small, though it's relatively inexpensive & BYOB so we didn't feel stung financially. All in all though, we'll probably get our curry fix elsewhere in future.
author: Fi M.

description:
Bite size samosas are delicious!. Great service and the waiter was really kind and friendly.
Quiet and nice atmosphere to enjoy a meal.
author: Al a.

description: Great hidden gem! You can byob and it's never packed. The service and food are both outstanding and the price and environment are casual. Great place for a group too! I have been several times and each I am more thrilled
author: B S.

description:
This time around the food was just as good. Chicken tikka masala was on point. BUT the service was deplorable. We could not figure out who our waiter was. It was a different person each time. No one knew our order and every one seemed so confused as to what to do. They were running around with their heads cut off. Granted it was much busier this time around. But there is no excuse. 

Dont get me wrong. Best Indian food in the neighborhood. But they need to get service in order.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Why do people still ask if I'm in the mood for Indian?? The answer is #yes.

Having missed all manner of reasonable times to show up late to NightLife -- Fancyface, myself and 3 of our friends  went in search of some chow. Enter Masala Dosa.

Unbeknownst to our group, Masala Dosa is a BringYourOwnBuzz kind of establishment, so  our server referred us to the uber convenient liquor store directly across the street. I queried whether the two businesses were owned by the same people.. which in my book means way more beverage variety and double the profit :)

Up to bat : 1 order Tandoori Prawns, 1 Chicken Biryani, 3 Garlic K'naan's, side order of rice and 3 orders of an old standby, the Chicken Tikka Masala. 

The Chicken Tikka was expectedly good. A little spicier than I tend to enjoy, but cut with the rice from the Chicken Biryani (yum!) , it was quality.  1 order was enough for 2 mildly hungry people to enjoy. 

Next up : Have I become a garlic k'naan snob? Too soon to tell, but, Masala Dosa's version left a little something to be desired. The bread was good, but maybe up the garlic ?

The Tandoori prawns turned out to be the underdog champ of the meal. A flavorful marinade on a hot piece of seafood with the perfect crunch. I tend to err on the side of chicken when it comes to the tandoori style of Indian cuisine, so the prawns were a pleasant surprise. (S/O to Fancyface and his *refined* palate.)

We had the cardamom, pistachio & rosewater ice cream, but I found the latter ingredient to be a little over powering. Im not much into anything rose flavored, unless Rosé counts..!

Our server was attentive at all the right moments and super helpful when deciding what to eat. I would definitely come back to Masala Dosa to try some of the other menu items I was eyeing :)
author: Shirene N.

description:
The dish I took was really good (Lamb Tikka Masala). It was spicy but not too hot, the meat was very tender and the amount of food was more than enough.
Price is good too.
But I was very disappointed in the naans and just ended up not eating it (which is almost half my treat when going to an Indian restaurant).
Service was ok.
author: Virginie F.

description: Delicious food, friendly staff. Their tikka masala dishes are fantastic (I usually get the paneer tikka masala), the rice cooked to perfection, and samosas are top-notch. Late-hours are a bonus.
author: Julie D.

description: My review is based on delivery only. This place has the best nan that I have ever tasted. Their other dishes do not disappoint. Excellent kormas and tandoori. However, it is VERY expensive (the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars). Delivery guys are also very sweet. For a treat it is excellent, but hard to justify a weekly order.
author: roz A.

description:
Really a 4.5 I would say... Masala Dosa turned my husband into a lover of Indian food so I will forever be a fan because of that! 

We have dined in (BYOB!) and have always had attentive service. We have also gotten take out a few times, I am a big fan of the chicken chana and the goat cheese naan and also like their tikka masala.  Will be back for sure!
