author: Kim U.

description:
Take-out review: okay more than often enough I want naan and tikka masala, I don't know why I crave it but I just do! After my fiasco with Naan-n-Curry (got food poisoning), I needed to find another place that would fulfill my craving and stumbled upon Masala Does - the reason why we did take out was because I am pretty sure there was a football game at the time and plus parking is a ---- at night here!

Chicken tikka masala was delicious and naan was also deliciious , I ended up cooking some rice at home cause I kept dipping and dipping and bam no more naan left for the chicken tikka masala! Everything stayed warm until I got home and was still pipping hot as I ate. I thought the portions looked small but it filled me up! I thought it was a bit spicy but tolerable but I am sure you can tell them to make it less spicy!

P.S chicken was nice and tender! Satisfied!
author: Mona L.

description: Love this place!  Best Indian food I've had in town.  We go back again and again.  Cheap!  Delicious!  Go there.
author: Kathy K.

description: My husband and I stopped by the place on our first evening in San Francisco. We ordered samosas for an appetizer - very flavorful and crispy. For entrees, we got chicken tikka masala and paneer tikka korma - both were very good. The sauces were not "watered down" as in many places and portions were very generous. Naan was the usual quality and nicely complemented the meal. It's a nice little restaurant and if we are ever in the Inner Sunset again we'll definitely visit.
author: Darya C.

description:
This place is good. I'm surprised the reviews are only mediocre.  The ambiance is clean and nice, food comes out quickly, and it's actually delicious and fresh.  The only issue is that it's far away.

I've had the Chicken Tikka Masala which is good-- a bit more on the tomato-y side which is better than the cream laden things I"ve had elsewhere.  I get the lamb palek everytime.  It's super spinachy and the beef is usually moist, never dry.

Delivery sorta sucks.  I've called for delivery and the time will vary depending on how busy they are (sometimes they won't even deliver).  However, they partner with a third party food delivery service on their site, so I go through that now... asynchronous and impersonal communication ftw. 

Also, this is a BYOB.
author: Katie C.

description: Your standard Indian restaurant but fancier inside. I ordered the masala dosa - the sambar was a small portion, dosa was yummy but smaller than most dosas I've eaten. Not sure if it was just the weekday I went but there was only one person taking orders and taking delivery orders on the phone so it was pulling a tooth and nail to ask each time for simple things like water, chutneys, onions - which is a normal accompaniment to all Indian dishes. The prices are standard to Indian restaurants, but higher than their neighbor 'Naan and Curry' which is far cheaper but then again doesn't offer South Indian dosas or uttapum. I would only come back if I craved a dosa. Clean ambiance.
author: A K.

description:
If you are in the mood for Indian food, look no further!  To start my friend and I had the Chicken Tikka Marsala, it was fanfreakingtastic. The chicken was cooked perfectly which is a rare find (usually it's over cooked or really dry with the Indian spices) and it was so damn tasty, my taste buds were tingling and overjoyed. For our entree we had the chicken curry with potatoes (forgot the name) again, really really good. It does warn you on the menu that it's spicy (you are chili-pepper warned!) but we thought it would be a kind of medium spicy, NO. IT'S VERY SPICY. Trust in that little chili-pepper. But I didn't mind. The rice is average as well as their naan. 

This place is like brand spanking new, so I understand that they haven't quite gotten their rhythm down, however, it just adds to the welcoming, friendly atmosphere. Service is very excellent, the owners are super nice and friendly, and they want to know that you are satisfied. Like the other yelper said, it's kind of cold inside, and a curtain to the kitchen would be nice :) Oh and it's reasonably priced for the amount of food you get! Always a good thing.

In conclusion, This place is great! I'll return soon for some naams! 
(see what I did there?)
author: Bee S.

description: This is my go-to Indian spot in the Sunset if I don't feel like eating buffet-style across the street at Curry Village. I'm not an Indian food expert, but I think the food is really good here! I always get either chicken Tikka Masala or Palak Paneer and a side of naan. I've tried the garlic, garlic basil, plain, and wheat naan. I liked all except the garlic basil had too much going on imo.  The service is pretty quick for dinner probably because they are expecting more people, but I recommend NOT coming here with large groups at lunch. They take forever because there is only one guy waiting tables AND cooking. We made a joke about it, but we realized it was true; he even discouraged us from ordering appetizers that day. I still recommend this place though, for the food! Just try to go during dinner time.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
3.5 Stars.

I almost always get chicken tikka masala at every Indian restaurant I go to. I like to compare it to the usual places I go.

So when I came here with a friend we weren't as hungry, so we shared a plate of chicken tikka masala and samosas. I must say, I love the rice with the sauce. I asked the waiter what was in it and he mentioned that it had a bit of butter. No wonder it had a "melt-in-your-mouth" taste. Mmm. The dish itself was okay, it was a bit different then what I'm used to.

The serving size of a dish is a bit small, but it is slightly more upscale than Naan N Curry. Nice place for a date, nice ambiance.
author: Mandy D.

description: Went there again and tried their veggie biryani. It was really good. Time I upgraded my review
author: Milana R.

description: I walked in on Sunday around 7 p.m. to place an in-person takeout order. I patiently sat right by the counter and waited for at least 10 minutes for my ~$30 order (chicken tikka, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and rice). I got home and discovered that they had given me an entirely incorrect order. I didn't have the option to get back in my car to drive to the restaurant for the correct order (it was bedtime for my two kids) so I ended up throwing it out and had cereal for dinner. I'm baffled as to how I got the wrong order being that the guy who took my order was the guy who later handed me the bag, and I was sitting there the whole time right in front of him. So disappointing.
author: Siobhan L.

description: I am a fan of hot food.   The food is delicious here.    BUT....I ordered out from home the other night.    Delivery took almost 2 hours to arrive!!!!     So be careful if you order after 9 pm.   The driver waited until all the final orders were in before he left the store....then my food was the last drop off.    The delivery guy said "how are you?"   I said  "HUNGRY!!"
author: phaedra g.

description:
I was really excited to try this place when I saw it had finally opened. It actually looked promising -- really nice interior and lovely people working there. Not to mention after reading the many positive yelp reviews I had to try this place for myself.

Sadly, by the time I left, I must say I was disappointed with my experience. Here's what I tried off the menu:

Samosas (2) $4 - The serving size for these was much smaller than other Indian restaurants I've been too. That was just my first impression. The texture was really good, but I found them to be quite bland.

Chana Masala ($8), Aloo Gobi ($9), and Garlic Naan ($3): The chana masala and aloo gobi was just average and I felt like it lacked seasoning. Considering all of the great Indian restaurants in San Francisco, there was nothing that wowed me about these dishes. However, the garlic naan was pretty darn tasty. That was the good news.
author: Sara K.

description:
Masala Dosa restaurant is a great place to have Indian food... Specially I like the masala dosa and Vedu vade with chutney.. It's delicious, if you are vegetarian masala dosa is the best..
They have other food chicken, prawns curry are so fantastic.. I could recommend all the foods served here are delicious.. Restaurant is so clean,manager/owner Jaffar and his staff are friendly, so attentive.
Presentation is fabulous....
I would recommend any one to come here try for the first time and you will come over and over I am confident...
I happened to travel by N Muni train to sunset and found this place on my way back to down town, I got off from train and went in side the restaurant, tried the food for the first time.. Since then every week Once or twice i am here for dinner....
author: Lasantha R.

description:
I started a way to judge restaurants that is quite accurate. Go once and ask the server for their best food. If it is good,  go for the second time and order other stuff and if they keep up with the quality, it's worth.
At my first visit I  was reccomended chicken tikka masala and lamb with cashew nuts sauce: awesome! both dishes were good, great flavor, and the service was prompt. 
Second visit after a week, I ordered samosa, Chicken Tandoori, Lamb Curry and Chicken Biriyani. Tandoori was watery (frozen chicken) and bland. No seasoning whatsoever. Lamb was full of fat and the meat was not tender. It was as a f they had cooked it and just put in the microwave before serving. Chicken biriyani was a complete joke. The  rice itself had decent flavor, but the meat was really bland and dry. Samosa was ok... obviously not fresh made but would not expect it.
The second visit was a complete disaster. The service is inconsistent and so is the food. 
It would be a 4 star on the first visit and 1 star on the second one giving an average of 2.5 but since I can't put half stars I am going with 2 flat stars.
author: Ashish N.

description:
Ordered the chicken vindaloo, garlic naan and samosa and REALLY liked it all. The vindaloo is exactly what I've been looking for in, and expecting of, Indian food: spicy, but really flavorful.   Samosa and naan were both tasty, as well. I just wish there was a bit more vindaloo for the price but I will be ordering from here again.

Regarding the overall price to meal ratio, I should say with the 3 items I ordered, there was enough for about two meals. I had it for dinner two nights in a row. If I wasn't such a pig the first night, and split it more evenly, it would've just enough both nights to satisfy without being full/not stuffed..
author: Jay P.

description: This is my first time here.  Nice ambience.  I had Chicken Tikka Masala, Garlic Naan, and Ginger Lemon Tea.  The Chicken Tikka Masala, was good & above average. The Garlic Naan was a little too dry for my taste.  The Ginger Lemon Tea had a good strong flavor, and served nice & hot. This was an above average dining experience, and I would come here again.
author: Robin A.

description:
I was thrown off to see that the menu was a mix of North and South Indian food. In hindsight, that should have been my warning sign as restaurants should stick to one or the other type of cooking. I had just assumed that with the name, they'd be a south Indian restaurant.

You'd think that the dish that the restaurant is named after would be prepared well, but apparently not the case here... dosas came out somewhat soggy and lacking much flavor. Sambar was very watery and didn't have much depth of flavor.

We split an order of tandoori chicken and garlic naan as well, and those were actually quite good (but at the same time, hard to screw those things up). I've had much better dosas pretty much anywhere else.

Service was extremely slow as there was only one guy running the whole front of the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon, with probably 15 customers there in total.

Inner Sunset is not a neighborhood I goto regularly, and if in the area, I likely wouldn't venture back to this restaurant. Though I would be curious to try their other "standard" Indian dishes like tandoori items, meat curries, etc. 

If you're looking for dosas, don't waste your time here.

PS - for whatever reason, cell phone reception sucks in the restaurant
author: Farhad M.

description:
I live in the Sunset, and this place has become my go-to Indian restaurant in the area.

In my experience, Indian restaurants tend to overcook the lamb. My work around for this is usually to get chicken. Here, they do the lamb curries very, very well. This is where they stand out. They do a perfectly decent chicken tikka masala, but lots of places can do that.

In terms of service, it has generally been positive, both dining in and delivery. We did have an experience where a delivery order was lost. Mistakes do happen - we all make them. The owner or manager was very apologetic and went out of his way to make things right.

I appreciate that he took the care to do that. It demonstrates concern and respect and a desire to do things well. Overall, it's a good omen all around.
author: Chris C.

description:
Came here for a ladies night and it was perfect for our group. Not only are they BYOB, they encourage it! They send you off to the corner store and you can come back with whatever wine or beer you want. So solid.

Food was good, hot, fresh. Our server (or maybe the guy that brought the food to us) seemed a bit new so that was a little awkward. However, everyone else who worked there were awesome. They were super friendly and funny too; made us feel very comfortable and we will definitely return.
author: Salina Z.

description: This place sent me the wrong order, when I called back the guy tried to talk me in to picking it up; if I had the time to pick it up I wouldn't have ordered it for delivery. 40 minutes later after I thought we'd set things straight, the delivery guy calls to try to convince me to get my order the next day and that it will take him 30 minutes to drive thru the park (it takes 10 for the record) so over two hours after my original order I'm still waiting,... so much for an easy dinner after a long day. The food is standard if not below, definitely not worth this charade....
author: Alx N.

description:
I visited this restaurant with a few friends for lunch around noon- we were the ONLY customers in the restaurant. It's definitely a NICER restaurant with respect to decor and table-setting, clean, and unlike the AYCE places around the area. 

Food: Not too impressive. Like any noob with indian food, I order the chicken tikka masala with basmati rice and an order of naan. My friend told me it's a south indian restaurant so maybe that's where I went wrong by not ordering the dosa. 

chicken tikka masala with basmati rice ($9.00): Average- a bit TOO creamy for my liking and not enough spice (OR chicken). It also came in a tiny cup-bowl so definitely not enough for sharing. Or me. BUT thanks to my love for carbs, the naan filled me up. 

naan ($2.00): I love carbs and this was my favorite part of this meal. That's probably not a good sign. But hey- at least i got some delicious carby-love in my belly.

Pros- I didn't leave smelling like I came from an indian restaurant so that's definitely a bonus. The service was nice, the place was clean and cute. Would I return? Probably not by choice or if I was desperate for indian food in the sunset. I would definitely order something different if I visit again.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Wow, they really turned this place around.  Don't know if the owners are new.  Prices are very reasonable.

DECOR:
The place is clean, new, modern, & tastefully decorated.  White table cloth napkins on top of black table top with silverware and white dishes.

Sorry - my spelling of some of the food words might be slightly wrong

FOOD:
What we ordered:
1) Garlic Naan - $3
2) Aloo Naan (one with potatoes) $3
both of the naan breads are very good and they can go with dipping sauce or eaten by itself.
3) Tandoori Section: Chicken Tiki Kabobb ~$10
Arrived in a sizzling hot plate with onion and a slice of lemon.  Taste great, but I was expecting some thing with a sauce so that I can dip my naan in, but taste good by itself too.
4) Curry Section: Lamb Vindaloo (spicy) comes with basmati rice ~$11
This dish had sauce and it taste great with both the rice & naan.  The rice serving was generous, almost two rice bowls worth and was delicious.

All this for 2 people.  We had a lot of left over and it will be enough for another meal.

DRINKS:
Didn't see booze of any type on the menu, but I did notice that someone had a bottle of wine on their table.  So they must allow you to bring your own...don't know if their is any cost to that

SERVICE:
Our waiter guy was super friendly and polite.  Might be the owner or associated with the owner.  Water filled promptly.  He asked how we liked the food.  They always said things like, take your time.

Would definitely come back to this place.  Another place we want to try is Naan & Curry down the street, but I like that this place is not a chain.
author: Sandra L.

description:
Food is delicious! Favourite is the korma, either lamb or chicken. Mango lassi is also excellent. 

The staff is very nice and helpful. 

No alcohol served here, but they mentioned that you could bring your own in.
author: Ellyn T.

description:
my masala dosa was awesome but my dining partner puked up his chicken korma, he thought the chicken might have been undercooked. 

also they don't have any really spicy chutneys or if they did they were hiding them.
author: Viv R.

description:
The chicken korma had chicken so dry it could suck the moisture right out for tongue.  The bland samosas were worse than the frozen one at Trader Joe's. 

The flies flitting about the middle of the restaurant and the dirty dishes displayed on the floor as a token of their popularity was perhaps a bit too much for my humble self. 
  
Don't get me wrong,  I have eaten at many a roadside shacks in India,  but finding something similar in terms of disarray but not the same level of amazing deliciousness titillating my senses was disappointing. 

Definitely not for anyone looking to have delicious Indian food in a clean hygienic environment
author: Vilay K.

description:
Received a private message from someone with vested interest in the restaurant's success:
"I guess you need to get yours eyes checked and than you will be able to see the difference bet. the two dishes. If the prices are too high why did you order the food? you should have walked out the restaurant. You should google a cheap place to eat before leaving home. And also, waiter was not sarcastic, as a matter of fact you are so cheap that you are blameing it upon food and waiters. I will give you a negative star being a stupid person."
author: Piyush K.

description:
Every time I come here the place is empty and I don't understand why.

Food is great. Service is awesome. Our waiter is always really attentive and checks in with us (maybe he's bored because it's only us idk)

Chicken tikka masala- delicious. Tender marinated chicken mmmmmm
Vegetable samosa- YUM CRISPY FRIED GOODNESS
Garlic naan- more garlic por favor
author: Jennifer H.

description:
It was fine.  Decent food (but not the best).  Okay ambiance (but not particularly memorable).  I brought my mom here and her dish was too spicy, so she ordered another one, which ended up being kind of awkward with the server.  (Personally I didn't think any dishes were too spicy, but it would have been nice if the server had been more attentive and accomodating). 

Will I be back?  Probably.  The food was good enough and nothing was objectionable.  But it's not the first place I think of when recommending a restaurant.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I was surprised to see our usual Indian place replaced by Masala Dosa. We went in and were pleasantly surprised by the ambiance. 
The food was great. I had a lamb tikka masala and the lamb was tender, and the sauce was delicious and creamy. 
The naan was also very good.
Service was a little bit slow, but it was fine because we ordered a lot of food. The chai was alright.
author: Emily L.

description:
This place delivers like nobody's business. GrubHub always tells me I'll have to wait more than an hour. ("You'll be eating delicious things soon!" -- riight.) These guys usually get to my door in 30 minutes with a smile.

I'm not a picky Indian food eater, so I don't know what makes it good. Some of their naan has arrived burnt. Don't ever get their side salad -- it's like four pieces of lettuce and one mini tomato. My favorite naans are the goat cheese, and the one with lamb cooked all the way through it. The curries have always been winners. The total bill tends to be more than I'd wish, but the large portions match what you pay for.
author: David S.

description: It's hard to find a good indian food place in the US and well I love food here!!! This is my third time ordering/eating at this restaurant and I really like it. I life spicy food, and I like that you can specify how spicy you want food when ordering from  here.
author: Sarai F.

description:
Superb food for the price of a casual evening.  The meat dishes are tender and you can tell that they actually slow-cooked the lamb or chicken in the curry.  You know how a lot of moderate-priced Indian food tastes like they just dumped some pre-cooked chicken into some sauce until it heated through?  Not here.  And the sauce doesn't separate into oily components.  They use good stuff here.

I think this place is usually so empty because they don't serve alcohol - but you can bring your own.  I've just moved out of the neighborhood, but I always meant to write them a yelp post - because I thought they deserved to be busy.
author: Thunersee V.

description: Yum!!! Great food and nice service!! Great for large parties. Also BYOB is actually a nice benefit.
author: Devin K.

description:
Do you like it when the wait staff ignores you and like to receive rude service? Then you should go to Masala Dosa. If you like to be treated like a human being then you should avoid this place.

I ordered a take out order from them thru Eat 24. When I arrived to the restaurant, there were three wait staff behind the host counter. I approached them and they were all organizing receipts and looking down. I told one to the wait staff that I have a take out order. He asked " What is your name?"  Then he looked down at the receipts and continue to organize. The guy next to him asked " What's your name?" . He then continued to organize receipts again. The third guy asked " What's your name?" . I had to give my name 3 times before getting a response or reply. He finally went to go check out my order in the kitchen. I waited near the counter. 

A bag of food arrived at the counter. The wait staff mumbled something. I said "Oh I'm sorry, I cannot hear you."  He mumbled again. The restaurant was quite noisy. I said " oh I'm sorry, what was that again?" He rolled his eyes and said " give me a minute." I was taken a back, because my food was paid for already and he was really rude.

I gave him a minute. I saw my friends there finishing up their meal. I walked there to say hello. I was waiting for them to approach me to tell me that my take out order was ready. 5 minutes passed.... 10 minutes passed. It wasn't until my friend noticed a green bag sitting there on a chair next to the exit for 10 mins. I asked the wait staff if this was my meal, they were still shuffling thru credit card slips. They said yes with out looking up. I asked if it was chicken tikki masala because the last time I had order take out from them they gave me lamb tikki masala and we did not eat it. It was $12 down the drain. They did not reply. I had to ask for them to check if it was chiken tikki masala. The manager huffed and grabbed the bag and took it to the back. Within  seconds he cam back pushed the container towards me and said yes. Then proceeds to look down and shuffle around credit cards receipts. 

What an awful way to treat a returning customer!!! Not even a sorry or a smile. This place has horrible customer service. Do not eat here if you want to be treated as a human being. Very rude!
author: Loun P.

description: I'm still waiting for my food to be delivered for 1 1/2 hours!  I called and they told me it will be here in 10 minutes.  10 minutes go by, no food.  Called them.  It will be there in 10 minutes.   HAlf an hour later it's still not here.  Liars!
author: Celeste F.

description: Great place!  Really friendly wait staff - didn't rush out out even though we were there really late.  Ambiance is great - hard to find many Indian places where you can bring a date - this is one of them.  Delicious Indian food - loved every bite!  Especially loved the curries (yes, including the Chicken Tikka Masala), the Masala Dosa, and the Mango Lassi.  And prices are definitely reasonable.
author: Greg B.

description:
Welllll.........

- I ordered the food, went to pick it up, brought it back to Blackthorn. There were no utensils or plates for any of the dishes.
- I went BACK to get plates and utensils and told them twice that I needed 3 sets of flatware/plates because the food was for 3 people. I asked to make sure they put everything in the bag, and one of the servers assured me they did. Once I walked out, I immediately looked into the bag to only find: 2 plates, 1 spoon and 2 knives. Seriously..... 2 knives? How the hell are we supposed to eat this with knives? On the way back to blackthorn I stopped at a nearby chinese restaurant and asked them for utensils. Common Dosa.......SOO annoying.
+ Servers were friendly, and smiling.

Conclusion: The food was good, to-go service was annoying, and for the price?? Id rather go to Noori Pakistani & Indian Cuisine on Irving.
author: Julia D.

description: I have come here on multiple occasions, the most notorious has been when I had a huge craving for Indian food and trekked across town for this mouth watering meal. I love indian food and this place is mainly jump started my love for it. It has one of the best tikka masala in the city and I love their garlic naan. The price range is about the same with other Indian food places ($12-$15) but it's well worth it. I usually have to have left overs which equates to my lunch or dinner for the next day. The parking is difficult to find on this street so I would suggest parking on a nearby residence parking and walking. Plus once you're done you can go to Holy Gelato , which is across the street (See My Holy Gelato Review). It's a pretty good date night place :).
author: Desiree C.

description: I have ordered (either via dining in or take out) from many Indian restaurants in my neighborhood (Sunset/Richmond areas) within the last year, and Masala Dosa is an example of why sometimes it is best to stick with what you know is good. I stumbled upon this place a couple years ago and have always been impressed. The service is attentive, the food delicious and reasonably priced. I think I'm most obsessed with their naan, with so many delicious options, with the Kabuli naan being a favorite. Yesterday after my latest dining visit, I ordered their special of the day naan to go: cinnamon cranberry goat cheese, and eating it now for breakfast reminded me that I must Yelp them. Chicken tikka masala, lamb korma, their samosas, etc. etc... all delicious...I could go on and on. Seriously, try this place. I am obsessed with Indian food, and so far I haven't found a place I enjoy more.
author: Jen D.

description:
I've definitely had better.
Masala Dosa is extremely expensive, for what it is. I mean it is a bit cleaner and more nicely decorated than other Indian restaurants; however, the prices are not justified especially not in the portion sizes or the quality of the food. 
I ordered the chicken tikka masala and it did not come with rice or naan, which is pretty rare, at most Indian places it comes with one or the other, OR BOTH!
The chicken in my tikka masala was extremely hard and the flavor of the masala was not in the chicken at all. It was like they cooked (over cooked, rather) some chicken and then poured some tikka masala sauce over the chicken. 
Probably won't be back. If you're in the area and are craving some Indian food, I would check on Curry Village, the ambiance is not as nice, but the food is much better and its buffet so you can eat as much as you want :).
author: Jessica L.

description:
I wanted to love it.

Dosas: nothing special - boring and lacking spice.

Parking was VERY difficult. Bus/cab here!

Alternative: no brainer here. DOSA on Fillmore. Pay a little more and get a MUCH better food experience.

NOTICE: No alcohol... a cold beer can really enhance a spicy meal but you're not going to get it here. FYI!
author: Rachel C.

description:
When you have over a billion people in a country, you're gonna find at least half a billion ways to cook the food.  This is a given.  Resistance is futile.

I wanted to love MD.  I wanted to make it my one-stop-shop for desi food, but alas it is not meant to be.

Ambiance: lovely
Food: good
Price: moderate
Service: sweet and often oddly timed
Overall: 3.5 stars

The bad:
Ironically, the south indian food ('dosas' and 'uttappam'), in my opinion, does not make the cut for the following reasons:
- the 'dosas' are not thin and crispy - they're rough in texture & (truly sorry to say this) cardboard-like
- the 'sambar' accompanying the 'dosas' is catered to the neighbourhood's spice level (ie, not authentically spicy), and tastes more like 'daal' and less like 'sambar'
- the 'uttappam' (cauliflower one we got in particular) seriously lacked spice/flavour and the cauliflower seemed very raw and overly crunchy, which means it really didn't fuse well with the 'uttappam' it was being cooked into

(If you're looking for good South Indian food, I have to say that the 'dosas' and 'uttappam' at 'Dosa-Valencia' & Dosa-Fillmore truly excel in taste, authenticity, and presentation)

The ok:
- samosas (I prefer the crispy/fillo-dough based ones they serve at 'Rotee')
- rice that comes with the curry entree
- chutneys that accompany the 'dosas' + 'uttappam'

The good:
- the chicken tikka masala
- the naan (albeit a little too crispy, still tasted good)
- the tandoori sampler platter
- the 'bhindi'/okra curry

In comparison to the rest of the indo/pakistani food in the area?
It's good.  Check it out and form your own opinion.  It's better than Naan'n'Curry (isn't everything?!), not as forgettable at Curry Village across the street, and not as over-priced as 'Masala' down the street. Plus, the owners who are frequently there seem super sweet and nice, so go show some community support and love.

Will I be back?
Sure, but will most likely stick to the North Indian side of the menu.

Again, over a billion and counting ya'll...and I'm just one of them!
author: Anjali V.

description:
Masala Dosa is the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to!

I remember when Masala Dosa first popped up, I was curious because I love Indian food so much, but I still hadn't found one place in particular that really stood out. The first time I went I was very impressed at the atmosphere and decor of the restaurant. There's are large windows facing 9th Street that really opens up the restaurant. Its the best restaurant in the Inner Sunset for taking in the beauty and charm of the neighborhood. 

When I finally tasted the food I was absolutely blown away. Everything on the menu tastes like a home cooked meal by a gourmet chef. The flavors really come through and are not covered up with cream and fat like a lot of other places. At Masala Dosa everything tastes so fresh and light which is amazing because you don't feel guilty about eating even more than usual. And after talking to the employees there they definitely make it a point to be healthier than other places, staying away from the cop out appeal of pure fat. 

There are so many scrumptious options to choose from from northern and southern India making Masala Dosa much more diverse than your average Indian restaurant. My favorites range from the Palak (Lamb or Mushroom), Chicken Tikka Masala, Chana Masala, Pakora and Fish Vindaloo. Even the breads are phenomenal. The Bhatura, Onion Naan and Goat Cheese Naan are out of this world. I always end up ordering half a dozen items (it helps that their prices are affordable) when I go or pick up from here and they always accommodate me with fast and friendly service.  Also the entire staff is very knowledgeable about the food  which always enhances the experience, learning the history and heritage of the dishes you're enjoying.
author: Dexter H.

description: I've been here probably four times. None have been exceptional, and the most recent was quite disappointing. The onion nan was clearly not fresh, and lacking in flavor. The chicken tikka masala was a huge disappointment. The chicken was clearly added to the sauce at the end, and had little flavor. The tikka masala sauce was good, but the chicken within it was very bland, and tasted a little stale. The saag paneer and samosas were good. Also, the waiter didn't ask us how spicy we like it (we like it flaming)...kind of basic service for an Indian restaurant. Other times I have been here the food has clearly been better, but never great. I live in Inner Sunset and so this place is convenient for me. Wouldn't go out of way to come here.
author: Brian H.

description: This place is probably my favorite Indian place in the city.  It's close to my work so I've been here for both lunch and dinner.  Their Dosa's are huge and amazing and come with lots of different fillings.  Many gluten free options.  All the curries I've had are top notch.  If you haven't been here and you like Indian food, something is wrong with you.
author: Kristina K.

description:
I went here for a late lunch. I must preface this review by saying that I don't have that much experience with Indian food, as there aren't any Indian restaurants where I come from. But I really enjoyed it -- spices so potent that they stick with you for hours after the meal. I ordered the chicken vindaloo ($9), garlic naan ($3) and basmati rice. The food was so flavorful that despite the portions being rather small, I didn't finish it all. 

The service was a little slow. I don't know if it's normal in Indian restaurants, but the rice came out after the dishes. It was a little hard to eat until the rice came out. That being said, the food was delicious, and it was an enjoyable experience overall.
author: Heidi H.

description: Another amercanized indian restaurant. Not worth going if u r really.looking for indian food.
author: Suraj N.

description:
The meats are tender, and the vegetables are always perfectly prepared.  Nothing is ever over or under.  The prices are fair and they now offer delivery which is fantastic.  

I know this review doesn't say too much but I will say that this eatery is on a perch looking down on all of the other subpar Indian food in the Sunset.  I really hope that they last.  Definitely give it a shot.
author: e m.

description:
Awesome Indian food! Seriously. We have tons of Indian friends and they love it.

I love the Curry and Ill eat here at least once a week.
author: Mario A.

description: My husband and I really like Masala Dosa. We get delivery from them often, and normally the same thing. We love the chicken korma! They has quick delivery and you can order straight from Yelp app.
author: Amy L.

description:
This tiny restaurant is the first treasure I've found while exploring SF! The Indian food is rather great. And I will be the first to admit that finding good south Indian food is harder then hard. Being Indian I've had my fair share of Indian food within the states and out side of the states, yes I do mean in India, but also other countries, and they have their menu down to a science. 

My favorite to get is always Masala Dosa but Ive been enough times to taste their curries, naans, appetizers and Uthapam. Their whole menu is made with a perfect balance of spices, oils, and meats/veggies. The biggest treat for me is not seeing a giant film of oil floating on top of any of their curries or sambars. Why? Because it lets me know that the cooks are in tune to their food and not just tossing everything in without a care. Another major plus is that everything doesn't taste the same... Curries should not have the same tastes, nor should the Dosa's, Uthapam or any other item on the menu. When I get two curries that are true to their taste I know Ive found an Indian restaurant I'll be addicted to. 

Besides the food though, the service is really friendly. Everytime I go in there is always someone ready to seat me and take my order. And when I go with friends who arent so Indian food saavy, the waiters take their time to explain what each dish is and what it will pair well with. On another note the area is great for a bit of mellow night life. BUT parking is impossible, dont bother driving, take the N train in or one of the many MUNI buses that stop through there. 

P.S. Typing this made me hungry ... I think I'll put in an order for pick up now. :P
author: Saumita P.

description:
Ironically, we didn't try any of the dosas, but we had a fantastic meal.

Chicken palak - very tender chicken and spinach, not greasy, and just the right amount of spice
Chicken biryani - so much flavor and spices packed into this dish full of tender chicken, it can make a great meal on its own
Lamb filled naan - delicious
Goat cheese, bell peppers, onion filled naan - very mild goat cheese, a little boring after the first few bites
Peas and paneer uthapam - probably my least favorite because it was a tad bland, but not bad

The ambience is very minimalistic, modern, and calming, and the service is great (constant water refills, friendly wait staff, food came all at once and very quickly.)  This would make a very cute date restaurant, but also good for smaller family meals--probably not a great place to bring young children for dinner.

I'm definitely coming back to try the other biryanis.
author: Audacity L.

description: The food here is fine--not amazing, not terrible, well-suited to a lazy weeknight when you don't want to make dinner. But, the delivery time has gotten ridiculous. It used to take about 30 minutes, but the last few times I ordered, it took over an hour. Last night, it was over an hour and a half. The food was cold and the nan was stale. I won't be ordering from them again.
author: Michelle K.

description: Worst food I ever had in any Indian restaurant. I think they have only 2-3 types on gravies / sauces - red sauce, green sauce and some other. They use same type of gravy with many dishes. I had ordered Malai Kofta (not on the menu, but it was daily special) and Paneer Tikka Masla. Both Malai Kofta and Paneer Tikka Masala came  with same type of gravy. When we asked server about it, he said, "yes, the sauce is always same". The gravy wasn't tasty as well. It was salty and had no other flavors. I think any preserved or frozen Indian food is better than Masala Dosa food.
author: Shan T.

description: This is my new favorite Indian place to order from. I used to be a loyal fan of Tandoori on Haight as they had decent food and were close to me, but after they closed the place I was in a constant search for a replacement. Then I tried Masala Dosa. What a pleasant surprise. Very generous portions, loads of meat, very spicy as it should be. Naan is home made, huge and very delicious, probably the best one I've tried in San Francisco so far. So far we've tried the classic chicken curry and butter chicken - both were outstanding. I order food this place at least once every couple of week.s
author: Igor P.

description:
Nice little place tucked between Irving and Judah. I ordered the spinach and onion pakora- very good fresh and crispy. Really good mint and tamarind condiments. The mint is a little creamier than I've had before, but that's a good thing!

I ordered the masala dosa. The dosa was nice and crispy, and has that wonderful bean flour taste I love. The filling was nicely spiced with potatoes and peas. Just right. The sambar was very good and flavorful, perfect on a chilly day. I didn't care for the condiments that accompanied the dosa, but everything else was delicious.

The floor felt rather sticky though, the only minus. It is rather dark inside as well. It was daytime and no lights were on. I know we're all trying to save a buck here or there, but I should not be squinting to see my meal.
author: Kris K.

description:
LUNCH

I don't know enough about Indian food to go wildly selecting different things on the menu. The one thing I'm sure of is that I really enjoy chicken tikka masala. If I order this dish and some nan with satisfaction, you can expect my repeated patronage. 

I ordered the chicken tikka masala and was surprised to find a slightly think non-uniform consistency, sort of like the oils had separated from the curry sauce already. The chicken pieces were nice and generous in size and portions. The curry was served with basmati rice but I went ahead and ordered a garlic nan for $3 anyway. I enjoyed the nan but couldn't get over how I didn't fully enjoy dipping it in the curry. 

If someone told me they really wanted to eat here, then I think I'd give them another try. But unprompted, I might  have to pass. 

Reading other reviews, I think it's pretty cool of them to let you bring your own wine without corkage fees.
author: Dennis L.

description: The novratan korma is legit my favorite in the world, and the samosas are amazing. This place has great delivery. My husband and I get delivery from here way more than I'd like to admit! It's super good and always comes piping hot. I totally recommend this place!
author: Erin D.

description:
Terrible, Dont go here. Its a disgrace that a place that serves such awful dosas is called "Masala Dosa".

We ordered 4 different kinds of masala dosa.
First of all the Dosa dint look good, half baked, the batter wasnt right and it wasnt salted . The masala was burnt and flavorless. 2 of the 4 dosa orders arrived after 30 minutes . Then the waiter told us the dosa griddle had some problem!! after servng the terrible dosas!!. We then ended up ordering idlis, and the sambar had undercooked lentils and tasted awful! 


Tha pakoras were alright but 2 of the 4 were half cooked on the inside.


The only good thing was the mango lassi which was very yummy.

I had food from Dosa Bawarchi near San Jose the day before, it was wonderful and wanted to try this place in the city on our trip. Such a big mistake!!! 

AVOID!!
author: Ayeswarya S.

description:
I often find my gluten-free friendly spots with a simple yelp search. Though, sometimes it can be hard to tell how good the options will be. I found a review for Masala Dosa that referred to a gluten-free menu, so I thought there must be something good there for me. Sure enough, the dosa section of the menu noted that all dosas were gluten free except for one kind. Fun! I had options!

Often times in restaurants where the owners and waitstaff do not speak English fluently, I have a hard time inquiring about whether the food is really gluten-free. With a lack of public knowledge of gluten-free issues, plus a language barrier, it can be hard to get the reassurance I need. I asked the waiter, a very nice guy with an accent, about whether any meats were prepared with flour, or if there was any flour added to the sauce. He said no, but he seemed to understand the importance of the questions, and said he would double check with the chef. He came back confirming that all the curries were gluten-free - no flour on the meat or in the sauce. Since I didn't get to talk to the chef, I have no idea if they really "got it." I can only trust that the waiter conveyed the importance.

My friend and I shared a masala dosa with chutney and a spinach and chicken curry. While not the most amazing Indian food I've ever had, they were both very tasty! The flavors were fragrant and rich and the quality of the food was quite good.

As I don't seem to be having a gluten reaction, I think the food was free of gluten contamination. I will definitely be going back to my new gluten-free Indian hot spot!

I can't eat dairy either, though I think it's easy to avoid the creme sauces and the paneer. I wonder about which items include butter that is not stated in the description. I'll have to ask about that next time.
author: Addie S.

description:
I've tried the Matter paneer (with basmati rice), which was decent but lacked any powerful spices I expected. The food is definitely on the heavier side and larger than most Indian restaurant portions.

I've also had the Paneer Pea Uthappam which I highly recommend if your starved. Dipped in the sambar or chutneys, this Uthappam was great!

Overall, Masala Doas has decent Indian food, but the service is a little slow.

# vegetarian review
author: Eric H.

description: I wanted to share our experience at the restaurant "Masala Dosa." We used to go to this restaurant years ago, when it was named, "Masala." Unfortunately, we thought that they were gone, when in fact, they moved a block away to 9th Avenue in the Sunset district with a different name, not knowing that it was the restaurant we loved. We had wonderful Chicken Curry and Palak Paneer with rice, mango chutney, mango lasses, garlic bread, raita and the food and drink were wonderful, as was the atmosphere and the wait staff. So, we wil be going there again soon. Just had to let others know what a great experience we had!
author: Donna C.

description:
Just moved to Inner Sunset and tried this place out because of their awareness of gluten-free and making sure it's easy to figure out what you can eat there. 

So far, everything I've had has been great (and I've tried a lot of Indian places in SF). The chicken korma is really well done. I've had the Uthappam as well and it was great. I haven't had their dosa yet, but judging by everything else, I'm sure it's quite good.

I would recommend this place and plan on taking friends here.
author: Marc C.

description: Came in here for a snack. All I can say is yum. Paper Masala dosa.  Can only give it 4* bc I've only been here once on a random Saturday afternoon. There were 2 other tables finishing food and we ordered 1 item that  still took a bit to get out to us. But the dish was super tasty.
author: Sharra C.

description:
I came here with a fairly large group of friends (since it is a somewhat small restaurant), and I'm not typically a fan of Indian food, but the food here was good.  We tried a couple chicken and lamb dishes, and I left satisfied.  The only downfall, for me, was the serving sizes were pretty small considering the prices.
But overall, if you're in the area, I definitely say this is a place to try at least once  =)
author: Angelica Y.

description:
The food was good but not rave-worthy, and the service was inexcusably terrible.

While my party of 5 was there for lunch, there was only one other table. They left, and a party of 2 came in. They were done with their meal before we got our entrees! There were only 2 sets of silverware on our table, and our server walked away as we asked him for 3 more sets. Since he was pretty absent (despite only having to wait on 2 tables in the entire restaurant), we resorted to taking silverware and napkins from one of the many other empty tables. Because of the slow service, we were pressed for time and tried to flag him down for the check. He was too busy laying out lots of extra napkins and silverware (again, we were one of 2 groups in the whole restaurant and it was nearing the end of lunch hour... instead of focusing on his actual customers who didn't get napkins & silverware, he was preparing a bunch of unnecessary ones!).

I normally don't care if service is not great as long as the food is delicious. But this experience was pretty frustrating, especially since we were paying a good amount of money and appeared to be 60% of their lunch business for the day.

Food:
- The dosas are HUGE.
- The samosas are good, but nothing special.
- The pakora appetizers were really interesting - not samosa-like as we were expecting, but veggie fritters. They were a tad spicy.
- The vindaloo appetizer was just chunks of meat over a basic salad (lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber)... not what we were expecting.
- The mango lassi was very watery and tasted fake-sweet.
- The garlic naan was delicious, but smaller than I was expecting (especially considering the size of the dosas).

If the service had been decent, I would have given this place 3.5 stars. But my experience left me not very eager to come back.
author: Amy X.

description:
We were happy with Masala Dosa.  The garlic naan was perfect, the portions were generous and the wait staff helpful.  My tikki masala was yummy (the chicken was very tender) and my bf's dish (can't remember the name) was great.  

They do NOT charge a corkage fee (they don't serve alcohol) so we enjoyed our food with a wine we brought.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Very nice Indian food, especially for the Inner Sunset, where previously Naan & Curry has been the only option.  Masala Dosa's main food is southern Indian, including excellent dosas, puri, bathura, etc.  

Been here twice.  Tonight we had the "shrimp dosa" which was a masala dosa with tandoori shrimp added to the potato and spice mixture, as well as a goat-cheese-stuffed naan, both dishes showing they can be creative while still being Indian.  Everything was well and extravagantly seasoned despite not being too spicy (in deference to my wife).  They also have Northern Indian standards on the menu and do them well.

The only thing they don't have down is the service, which is a bit uncoordinated.  However: $20/person, and we were stuffed.

Masala Dosa doesn't have an alcohol license, but they allow you to bring your own beer or wine.
author: Josh B.

description:
Beautiful decor - a nice cozy date spot.

Nice waitstaff, although I could use a more frequent water refill!  *fans mouth*

But how is the food, you ask?  Fan-freaking-tastic.  While I didn't care for the dosa (it's not my preference), the curries are really delicious.  The chicken korma is, hands down, the best I have ever had.  The chicken mahkni was also amazing.  The +1 and I are slowly making our way through the curry menu, and loving every bite of it.  From the appetizer menu, I can attest that the pakora is also quite tasty.

Also, it's inexpensive.  $9 gets you a great portion of curry, with plenty of meat - and rice is included!  That's cheaper than when we order delivery from India Clay Oven.  

I got a new love, and its name is Masala Dosa.  Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Jennie K.

description: The chicken korma and the tikka masala is good.  The garlic naan and the goat cheese naan is awesome.
author: Will L.

description:
3.5 stars really.

I waver.  I come here a lot and the servers are SO warm and welcoming.  The place is BYOB which creates a fun, down-to earth atmosphere.  The decor is very cozy and the food is delicious

I would recommend trying the cranberry, goat cheese, cinnamon naan.  such a unique treat. The Lamb Kofta is another favorite.  The Chicken Tikka Masala is classic. 

My only gripe is the price you pay for what you get.  The curries are small but rich so I usually leave full BUT each dish comes with only a few chunks of meat, so it's mostly the delicious fatty sauce that ends up filling you up.  If you try to split dishes among friends, each person gets literally one chunk of meat.  Also the palak paneer is on the blander side of the Indian places I've been to.  Each thing, naan, rice, chutney, curry, veggies, you must order separately so the bill ends up being way more than I expect each time.
author: Meg M.

description: We go to this restaurant frequently and my favourite dishes are tikka masala and biryani but we found whatever dish we order, they come out good. I have been to many indian restaurants but this one is better and I recommend this to my friends all the time
author: Keerti Sekhar S.

description: Every visit to Masala Dosa has been perfect. Fantastic food, good service, and lovely atmosphere. The dosas are tasty and very large. There's a wide selection of naans and breads. My favorite dish by far is the unbeatable Novratan Korma. Masala Dosa is a quiet place -- a well-kept secret of the Inner Sunset.
author: C. C.

description:
First and foremost, the food here is amazing. The tikka masala have the depth of flavor that you would hope everywhere would infuse. 

Secondly, the staff is great. Masheed(sp?), one of the cooks, took his time to talk to the guests , myself included, to tell us about other off-the-menu items that he thought were exceptional. I will definitely try them. 

Lastly, the decor is gorgeous. The windows seats are my favorite.
author: Sean M.

description:
3.5 stars

This used to be the spot for Tasty Curry. New re-model and design look great! Not sure if its the same owners or new ones. But definitely an updated modern look with warm colors are easy on the eyes. 

We came in for a weekday dinner.  Only one other couple was in the restaurant. I really liked the remodel (new owners too?). Very modern and clean. We tried to samosa, chicken tikka masala, lamb birayana and garlic naan.  We liked all except the lamb birayana. Definitely like the mint spicy sauce that they bring to your table! yum! 

Service was a little slow considering there were only 2 parties in the restaurant while we were dining.
author: Julie F.

description:
The food here was disappointing. The portions were so small. The curries come in a little bowl and don't come with any rice or naan, so you have to order your own naan. The naans were delicious; I would recommend the garlic and cilantro naans. You get 4 triangles of naan which are more than enough for one person. 

I had the tandoori chicken which was flavorful, but I think paying $10 for two chicken thighs is a little overpriced. My chicken curry had no spicy kick to it and tasted pretty plain. The chicken curry that came with vegetables in it was even less flavorful probably due to the vegetables watering the curry down.
author: Sophia L.

description: It was ok. The dosas & the uthappam were on the soggy versus crispy side. The maysore dosa wasn't that spicy. And the sambar was very watery. I wouldn't come back.
author: Khozema S.

description:
Two things I feel people have not mentioned on their review for Masala Dosa, 

1. they do not serve alcohol, but you can bring your own bottle of wine and there is no corkage fee! 
2. they serve some gluten free food! 

The food was very good, great price, and very friendly staff! For sure a place I will be going to again!
author: T C.

description:
Having some northern indian food here in the states was a reminder from my trip in asia.

First off, the people there are super kind, but since we had gone when they first started, their wait staff was still a litttttle under trained. 

The food there is pretty good. Not the best, but it was good. I would definitely go back to get more. 

The place is kind of set up weird. There's like an area that is a step up from the rest of the restaurant. They also have this weird peach colored cloth too. It's just a little weird.
author: Nina Y.

description: Best for Indian food in the Sunset. Their Okra curry is good.
author: Ravi S.

description: i tried samosa and myosre masala dosa here ,its very good and my friend ate lamb biryani , first we thought its just north indian style biryani but its same like hyderAbadi dum biryani ,nice service by front guy ,i will definitely recommend to my friends
author: Dhruva R.

description: In their defense, they said it was a busy night.  However, if ordering delivery from them on a busy night means it takes an hour and a half for rubbery samosas and watery paneer tikka masala to finally make it to my door, I'd rather not take the risk.
author: Lynne H.

description:
2.5 Stars

The service was terrible, the food was decent but not worth the price.

I ordered samosas for the table before I even sat down since we were hungry and I knew they'd most likely be good. These took forever to come out.

You get ONE piece of naan for $3+. The waiter actually laughed at me when I asked for an order of naan for the table (of three). Sorry, you don't laugh at your customers. Rude.

The Bhindi Masala (okra etc) I ordered came with stems still in it. I mean, I like fiber, but I also like to be able to chew and swallow it.

The chicken tikka masala and chicken Korma were plenty good.

All of the portions are medium-small. Not quite small, but definitely enough for one person. We split three dishes family-style.

Now let's get back to the service..
When we arrived there (2pm on a Tuesday) there was only one other couple seated inside. This is fine to me, it was after the lunch rush in the Inner Sunset. I don't expect it to be packed.
Shortly after we got there, the other table left.
This is when the waiter just plain ignored us. He was sitting in the front playing with his phone.

We had to get his attention when we needed water refills, and even when we needed the check.

After he brought the check, without asking if we were finished with our food, he started clearing the table. My friend was clearly not finished, accentuated by the fact that he yanked the last piece of Naan off the plate as the waiter was picking it up. Then the waiter took the bowl of curry sauce right as my friend was about to dip the naan into it.

We were all shocked.
I do not think I will ever go back.

Edit:
I forgot to mention that the waiter also "forgot" to add into the total the charge for 2-garlic naans, so he threw it in the "tax" field on the paper slip. He didn't even CHARGE us tax. 
This waiter apparently had an issue with speaking to people, as well. Everything he said came out very quiet and mumbled. His English was perfectly fine, if only I could hear him when he was answering my questions about the bill.

$38 EVEN for 3 dishes, 1 appetizer, 2 orders of naan. Oh wait, no it wasn't because the final total didn't include the additional $3.00 for that second order of naan. $41 even for all that.
I'm just glad he was able to split the bill evenly.
author: Ash K.

description: The food was ok, but the portion sizes were half of what they should have been and twice as expensive. We also had to pay for rice, which seems a little silly when you order dishes that are supposed to be served with rice. The service was also terrible. We were the only table, but we had to wait for twenty minutes for water. My friend found a bone in her lamb, and they brought our bread nearly fifteen minutes after our entrees. I will never go back.
author: Kendall H.

description:
Indian and married to a south Indian so know a bit about Dosas and such :)

Bland food. Sambar did not have salt. Dosas lacked taste. The chutneys were bland. My fish masala wasn't anything to write home about. Overall, seems like a mom-pop amateurish production.
author: TwinPeaker J.

description:
Went here on a Thursday night around 9pm with my friend We made reservations although getting a seat was no problem. There were only a few other groups of people inside eating. Decor is nice, very modern, simple and CLEAN. 

Our waiter was very nice, helpful and not pushy at all. We both ordered curry dishes the Chicken Makhni and the Chicken Tikka Masala. we also added a side of garlic naan bread. Our waiter asked how spicy each of us wanted our entrees which I thought was nice.

Food came out quickly and was all delicious. Serving sizes where large for the prices they charge. We are definitely coming back. The only negative thing I can say is that it was too warm and stuffy inside the restaurant. The windows were fogging.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
There are so many Indian restaurants in the area, but this at the top of the list and  will definitely be back.
Food was fresh and yummy.  Service was extremely nice and the restaurant interior was clean and modern.
We ordered the matter paneer, chicken tikka masala, plain naan, masala dosa and mango lassi and I enjoyed every dish!
author: A R.

description: I had a really good meal here. The dosa was yummy.  The lamb was tender.  The waiters were very nice and attentive. Also it is BYOB without a corkage fee.  Great neighborhood restaurant.
author: Courtney C.

description:
This is my new favorite Indian place!!! Yea-uh!

I've come here twice but wanted to go back immediately after the first night. Each time I've come, it's been empty but fills up as it gets later. You know what they say, the night is young, but I am not.

Decor: Dim. You can either take this as romantic or just dark. I like that the tables are dark wood and the stuff on it is simple and minimal.

Service: They seem to have one main guy who knows a lot and at most 2 other waiters. Since I go when the night is young, they have nothing else to do but wait on me.

Food: 
- I CRAVED naan the first time so I had both the regular and garlic naan. Garlic lovers should definitely get the garlic naan. It is so powerful vampires would die. For me, I prefer the regular naan to dip with the curries. Mmmm naan.

-Samosas: 2 big ones for each order. I like that there's a kick in it but it's not overly spicy. 

- I asked the main dude what he prefers and he went through the WHOLE menu section by section saying what he liked in each. It almost sounded like everything but I don't blame him b/c it's all pretty good. Overall, I love the paneer tikka masala. It's cheese only but they make it themselves, which is pretty impressive! There's a slightly sweet taste to it as well. I've also tried one of their chicken curries and a spinach one (which isn't as bad as you'd think), but I always go back to the cheese one. Cheeeeeeeeeeeese. All curries come with their special rice. The secret to their rice (besides the spices)? Butter. Thanks Paula Deen!

Price: Definitely affordable! For 1 order of naan, 1 order of samosas, and 2 curries, the total cost was about $26. Nom nom.

Overall, I'd give it 5 stars but I know they're still working out some kinks in a new restaurant business. Thank you Masala Dosa. I will be back.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Yes yes! As an Indian who knows about these things ( or at least am expected to) I give this place 5 stars. Let me explain: 1. It is unique because they offer south Indian food like dosas and north Indian like chicken tikka masala. 2. While there are many Indian restaurants in the sunset, none are south Indian. 3. Also unlike the other Indian restaurants in the neighborhood this one has a nice calm modern atmosphere-- does not make you feel like you are dining at a roadside truck stop in New Delhi. 4. The prices are so so reasonable compared to  trendy (and awesome) Dosa in the Mission. And 5. The food is very very good! 

Please note: they don't serve alcohol but I saw some other tables had brought their own. 

Also please note:The staff is new and the place is figuring out it's rhythm -- we had to wait a while for our chai refill and then had to just forget about it  because our baby was getting antsy. Also the guy forgot to give me my credit card back and then remembered as we were leaving.
author: SoSo O.

description:
When you walk in, you'll notice the ethnic smell is really strong but after you sit there for ten minutes, you won't notice it anymore.

Masala Dosa: I don't remember what was in this but it was tasty. I'd recommend it.
Garlic Naan: They really overdid it on the garlic. It was so garlicky that it was spicy almost and all you could taste, was the garlic. This was the only thing my friend and I did not finish.
Chicken Tikka Masala: I thought the sauce was flavorful and the chicken was juicy. It wasn't the best food I've ever tasted but it was definitely good. My friend however noted that she's had better elsewhere. 
Basmati Rice: Is basmati rice supposed to have a crunchy texture? I wasn't sure but it felt like the rice was undercooked.

Price: My friend and I shared and it was only about $10 between the two of us. The portions were just enough to fill the both of us. I think the portions would be a little small for men or any bigger eaters.
Parking: IT LITERALLY TOOK ME 40 MINUTES on a WEDNESDAY NIGHT at 8:30PM to find parking. I wasn't aware this restaurant was in this area but if I had known, I would have never picked it. Once I got there, I figured it wouldn't be that bad seeing as it was past the busy time and a Wednesday night but boy was I wrong. Unless you're carpooling, driving a taxi or taking the bus, I wouldn't ever recommend anyone to come to eat in this area. They really need to figure something out.
author: Karen C.

description:
Mmm, this is such a good find. It feels like this is somewhat of a secret hideaway, because it's always pretty empty when I find myself here. But don't let that fool you--Masala Dosa serves up some great South Asian cuisine.

Admittedly, I've only tried two things here, mainly because of two reasons: I fear change. And I love paneer. 

I get the paneer tikka masala and garlic naan with a side of rice. The naan is incredibly fresh, and the garlic is roasted just right. Now, I really love garlic, so my idea of "just right" might be "Hell no" to someone else. Keep that in mind. Luckily, they have an assortment of breads to choose from--including onion, goat cheese, and aloo (potato-stuffed) naan. 

The paneer is served with the most delicious, creamy, full-bodied sauce ever. I usually get it mild because I date a spicy-phobic person, but it's still got a great kick regardless. 

The service is unbelievably attentive and quick, and it's very well-priced for a sit-down restaurant. Definitely an Inner Sunset favorite.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Lovely.  And huge portions of dosa.  The Mysore was just spicy enough, and when stuffed into the dosa, almost didn't fit onto the plate.

We had two different pakoras, which while satisfying, were just a bit lacklustre.

The service was friendly, and I'm sure we'll be back!
author: Ken B.

description:
This was some of the best Indian food i have ever had. They have JUST opened so a few kinks - kitchen couldn't quite keep up with the full house; service a little spotty but working hard to improve. they have a cousin working weekend nights to try to help with the flow and i think they'll get it right soon. 
And the food - oh my! We had:

chilli Pakora - think Indian bite size chjile relleno - awesome goodness, not TOO hot.
Tandoori appetizer - plate full of bite size chicken, seek and lamb tandoori all cooked to perfection. 

Spring Dosa - dosa lentil pancake filled with fresh vegetables, with accompanying lentil soup, hot sauce  and homemade raita that is delicious. 

Chicken Tikka Masala - the best I have ever had, good sized portion, spicy but not overbearing. 

As i said service is new and not really coping when it's super crowded but they are obviously working on it. We got there around 6:15 and by 7 it was jam packed. Had to wait a bit for our food so for the short term I wouldn't go there super hungry waiting to eat IMMEDIATELY. Flip side also is, they don;t rush you out, you are encouraged to take your time over a cup of chai. 

Now i eat Indian food a lot, not at Naan and Curry which I do not like at all but at places like Shalimar, Tikka Masala, Pakwan etc. Masala Dosa is a little pricier but the choices, the quality and portions are so  so much better than average that it is my new favorite place. it's also beautiful inside with  staff that really go out of their way to be helpful.
author: Roberta D.

description:
I've been craving some naan for the past few days, so A and I decided we'd have some Indian food sometime this long weekend.  Well, last night was the night!  I did a Yelp search for Indian food and found Masala Dosa.

Note:  The last time I had a craving for Indian food, we went to Naan n Curry and I had a grumbly stomach for DAYS afterward.  We decided we'd cool it on the extra spicy foods and see if I'd have a better experience this time.

We walked over to Masala Dosa and were greeted by the man at the front (I noticed each employee didn't really have one specific duty.  They could be the host/hostess, server, table clearer - basically, whatever was needed.)  We had the option of being seated at a table further in the restaurant or wait for them to clean one of the window seats.  I opted for waiting for the window seat.  It's bright & airy and under this canopy of curtains.  The rest of the restaurant was darker and had a more romantic feel to it.

We ordered the Garlic Naan, Chicken Vindaloo, and Lamb Tikka Masala.  I also had the Mango Lassi and A had the Lemon Ginger Tea.  Oh yes, and we decided to order a Dosa!  We'd never had a dosa before, so thought we'd give it a try.  I can't remember which one we ordered though.  It was a gigantasaur triangle filled with meat & veggies and came with three dipping sauces/soup.  Definitely yummy, but too big for us to finish with everything else we ordered.

The naan was tasty and comes with 4 pieces.  Good to dip in the dosa sauces or the sauces for the Vindaloo or Tikka Masala.  I liked the Lamb Tikka Masala.  Creamy sauce, very flavorful, and not too spicy.  The Chicken Vindaloo was really good, but too spicy for me.  I just had a couple pieces of the chicken and let A eat the rest of that.

The service was excellent.  They kept coming to check on us and make sure we were doing okay.  They packed up our dosa with the dipping sauces at the end of the meal so we could take it home to munch on.

Total cost for two people ~$45 plus tax/tip.
author: Kris L.

description:
This is by far the best Indian restaurant overall I've dined at in a long while.
Right when we walked through the door we were greeted very courteously by the host.

The dishes we ordered: curry lamb, tandoori chicken, & a Bhindi dish took a while to come . . . but when we ate, it was apparent why : they took the time to prepare food just right;  and it was delicious -- so good that I over-ate.

A waiter periodically asked if all was well.
The boss' wife Sima, also came to greet us personally.

Thumbs up! Yummy food!
author: Jason H.

description:
Masala Dosa has quickly become our go-to place for Indian cuisine. I used to go to Naan N Curry down the block but after reading the recent reviews on Yelp, I decided to try this place (and it didn't disappoint). We've eaten here twice and both times they've given us window seats. I have this theory that they put their best looking customers near the windows. 

Their paneer tikka masala is legit. We've also had the chicken tikka masala, which is good, but their homemade cheese is too awesome to pass up. Their garlic naan is fresh and fantastic but might be strong for some people, so if you're on a hot date I'd stick with the naan. Each curry comes with a huge bowl of rice. If you're in the mood for curry but aren't hungry enough for naan, I'd just use the complementary rice. 

The staff has been friendly and has always taken the time to answer our questions. 

My tummy gives Malasa Dosa...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description: Very friendly staff and good service, but the food is mediocre. The chicken and lamb dishes always taste a little bit 'off' to me (like the meat is not that fresh), and the naan is consistently soggy and burnt tasting at the same time.
author: Heidi M.

description: Great food, very clean and nice atmosphere and friendly service. Seems that the reviews here are a mixed bag but I would definitely recommend this place. The lamb biryani was fantastic and the servers were attentive and patient. I also love that it is BYOB! Serving sizes were decent and still had plenty of leftovers to take home between the two of us.
author: Lisette P.

description: The food was delicious, a feast. The service was great in dealing with our constant ordering and staying til closing.
author: Scott P.

description: Great food! And it's gluten free for most of the items on the menu. They do not have a liquor license but they do not have a corkage fee and there is a liquor store on the corner with a decent wine selection or simply bring your own. It's small and quiet perfect for date night or night out with friends.
author: Lawanna N.

description:
Great service, check! Great food, double check! Take out, check! Delivery... needs to happen soon!

They are the better Indian place in the Sunset area, PERIOD!
author: Ms. Hala A.

description:
I just ate my first paper dosa -- those things are huge and fun to split with the table. We also got the chicken vindaloo (it was _actually_ spicy, as advertised) and the pakora (wish the serving was bigger, but this is no buffet). I too saw other people with their own wine they brought in, but it would be better if you could order a glass off the menu since I don't carry alcohol on my person as a matter of course.

What is special is that this is a nice place, atmosphere-wise and an improvement over what was there before in that regard. I will definitely go back (and preferentially over Naan n Curry). 

Service is very good; I think we had the most ambitious water re-filler on the planet.
author: Catt G.

description:
It just opened today! It's right where Tasty Curry used to be. The chicken in the Chicken Tikka Masala was juicy, and spiced just right. I would give 5 stars just for that and nothing else. The rice, Mango Lassi and Panak Paneer (I hope I spelled that right) were pretty standard, but good, the Onion Nan was awesome.

As for atmosphere it was a tad drafty but pretty inside, and I wish they had at least a thin curtain on the archway separating the dining room from the kitchen, I felt like I should wave to the guys cooking or something. Though, being their first day open, they're probably working on those things.
author: Christina W.

description: Worst experience ever....waited for 30 mins...without anyone giving us water or asking for water. Looked around and it wasn't even busy...told the owner and he was incredibly rude, saying you have to ask for water...wtf...never going back and urge others not to go back!
author: Shane K.

description:
LET'S KEEP THIS SIMPLE: I don't like to give people the eyesore of their epic experiences, word for word and about how we sat down and the waitress rolled her eyes and what not.

SERVICE: Excellent!! extremely nice & welcoming! 

FOOD: Perfect portions, although I like to see a little more!
All they need is a bottomless refill of chai!!

SANITATION: (most important to me) Clean! Didn't use the restroom, So If I do.. I will have to update this. haha

WHAT I GOT: garlic naan (slightly burned), Already cut for you! Chicken masala, and Chicken tandoori! All was delish. & of course a cup of chai! 

SO WHATS THE BIG DEAL??
Almost fancy like! haha Food was amazing!! Everything tasted so healthy. Not thickening like other indian restaurants. Gotta say if you like indian food, you should try here!!

OTHER NOTES:
Got SUPER gassy.. but I lived to tell my story!
author: Steph L.

description:
Basically, not worth the prices. Lamb in the lamb vindaloo was like jerky, chicken in the tikka masala was dry, and rice didn't have enough water.  They also kept forgetting my order of naan which I was looking forward to.  My friend also got their masala dosa and feels nauseous an hour after eating it.

The people working there are really nice though and apologized for forgetting my order. The waitress offered us rice pudding to make up for it, but we had to leave.  Granted  it's their first week, but I won't be going back for the food anytime soon.
author: Jenn K.

description:
Growing up eating dosa my mom cooked every weekend, I'm always psyched when a new South Indian place opens up in the city.  With a name like "Masala Dosa", I want to come and eat the dosa - not all the other north indian dishes, no matter how tasty they might be.

Overall, I was happy with the food at Masala Dosa but not enthralled.  The pakoras and vada we got for appetizers were really tasty.  Not the most authentic you'll find, but with an added sweetness that hit the spot.  Pretty impressive.  The Mysore Masala Dosa, however, was somewhat lacking in flavor.  Definitely not the best around - no competition for Udupi Palace.  Hence the three stars - dosa is the focus of this review.

Service and decor were both on the money.  Price point is right for a South Indian joint (i.e. dosas ~$8 or $9).  Right now big ups for being BYOB (though not sure how long that will last).
author: Arun W.

description:
Food was good, interior was clean and modern, prices are very fair :)

I liked all the food we got: samosas (use the sauces), garlic basil naan, "roti", spinach and cheese curry, and the masala dosa (for the sake of the restaurant being named after it). If bringing in out-of-towners, I recommend this place over Naan and Curry for its tidier interior.
author: Lana L.

description: Aside from the price vs size issue, this place is pretty good.  The chicken madras is crazy good, and much tastier than the oh so boring tikka masala.  I think they deliver via EAT24, but want to say that their prices are much higher with the delivery service.
author: Joel M.

description: Service is very slow which spoils the mood ... 25 min for 1 dosa that to with not much ppl in here
author: Shaleen A.

description: Good food! So happy to find another go-to Indian place close to home. Good mix of both North and  South Indian cuisine, so there should be something to make everyone happy.
author: Nichole F.

description:
This is my new favorite place in the sunset!!!  There are plenty of Indian options near by, but none of them serve Southern Indian food.  Masala Dosa does both Southern Indian food as well as my favorite Northern dishes like tikka masala and palak paneer.  
The dosas are gigantic and perfectly crispy.  They are accompanied by the usual sanbar and chutneys which are both delicious.  The tikka masala sauce is maybe the best I've ever tasted.  
Most importantly, the people are really nice here.  I saw one waiter run down the street to bring a customer his leftovers.  The first time we came they were packed and a bit understaffed for the rush.  On our next visit, all of our food came promptly.  
If you live in the sunset, you should eat at this restaurant.
author: Paul A.

description: You must try the baingan bharta, it is pretty good at this restaurant.
author: Cece L.

description: I had never tried dosas before and these were delicious.  It was a Friday night and I was with a group of 7 people of varying hunger levels.  We needed a relatively quick and reasonably priced place that could accommodate the group before catching a musical downtown at 8pm.  Masala Dosa was the makeshift solution.  The waiter pushed 2 tables together and we were served very efficiently.  Those of us who weren't very hungry were able to share a dosa and it was plenty filling.  It was surprisingly loud in the restaurant but we definitely contributed to the sound levels so this is not a complaint.  Very vegetarian friendly and the variety of dosas was excellent. I'm glad I tried this
author: Kryssi W.

description:
Solid presentation, clean ambiance, and tasty, but not heavy Indian cuisine. Not a stuffy or chaotic Indian restaurant at all. :-)

The lamb dishes are my fave; though I wish they had lamb chops.
author: Omar M.

description:
